author: {'steamid': '76561197966316076', 'num_games_owned': 1127, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1697751259}
review: This game is easy to pick up and play, difficult to master. Not much story, but let's be honest you don't need it here. This is what you should expect from the original creators of Descent: Six-Axis free flying and shooting. Just you, your guns, and a whole mess of malfunctioning mining drones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012801270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 74122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11067, 'last_played': 1697427953}
review: The people who made this game clearly put a lot of love into it. They paid tons of attention to details, making sure everything about it runs smoothly and is well-balanced. It's very easy to settle into, just go with the flow, and lose track of entire days while playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796181260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1581384629}
review: This is a great deal of fun.  I'm not sure why it isn't as much fun as I remember Descent being, but that may simply be how cool it was  that long ago and how old I am now.  If you enjoyed Descent, you WILL enjoy this and I think it is still the best 6-degrees of freedom shooter out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970720616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 7311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7292, 'last_played': 1642887139}
review: Great homage to Descent. The spiritual successor and has everything I remembered from the original, but with modern graphics. I don't feel like anything is missing from this game, everything is just right including the final polish. Hats off to the dev team on this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053280840', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1678675120}
review:
I came across this came by accident while looking at old Decent 1 & 2 videos. Decent was probably my first PC game, and I always loved it. I always wanted to see another game like it, but assumed that it had been forgotten. Apparently not. 

Overload is essentially a new decent. It plays how descent played back in the day, except now it has all these nice graphical upgrades, some voice acting and an included upgrade system. It isn't surprising how similar it is, since apparently some of the same developers who worked on Descent have worked on Overload.

I've only played the first several levels and I am already hooked! I haven't been so pleasantly surprised by a game in a long long time. Pick this game up, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136167199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6986, 'last_played': 1588129376}
review: My second most favorite game, after Doom.  I played all levels of Descent 1, 2, and 3 when they were originally released by Parallax Software in the 1990s.  When Overload was released in 2018, it was a complete surprise to me and the most exciting event that year!  This game keeps you on edge just like the originals.  Overload and its soundtrack needs to be in your Steam collection!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008879549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1036, 'last_played': 1701636864}
review: Used to play the old Descent series back in the 90's and was thrilled to see this one come out. Plays just like old Descent, but with obviously better graphics. The first game in a long time that I'm actually enjoying. No loot boxes and all that other garbage like some of today's games.  Just buy and play. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982746769', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1243, 'last_played': 1688779744}
review: Positively enjoyable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007140180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1520, 'last_played': 1676939301}
review:
Overload is a fantastic action game. Controls, level design and AI of enemies are all top notch. I've finished the default campaign on medium "hotshot" difficulty, and sometimes I had to reload 5 times or more to handle the carnage, so be aware of selecting anything higher than "hotshot". The placing of secrets is great, and even the 3D map is done in such a way that is very helful. 

Summary: similar to old Descent games, but better in every aspect, not just graphics.
Overall 9/10

Room for improvement 
- I couldn't find good key bindings for weapons. I wanted to just have some mouse button dedicated to my favorite primary weapon, and another to favorite secondary.
- I didn't find a way to see how many secret I've found during playing the level. So only way is to finish the level, and the reload to find missing secrets (if there are any).
- the enemies look all the same, they have same shape and colors, so it's very difficult to distinguish between them during the fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296419082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 65848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 415, 'playtime_at_review': 43007, 'last_played': 1711815164}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006197499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3201, 'last_played': 1690464632}
review:
It's Descent.

If you played games in the nineties, you'll know what Descent was. Vertigo-inducing, claustrophobic, and unplayable without the in-game map.

Yeah, it's Descent. The developers of Descent 1 and 2 came back and made this. Gameplay is basically identical to those old classics (most of the weapons from Descent return under different names), plus some RPG elements that reward exploring and finding the secrets.

I 100% recommend it if Descent is your thing.

The only part missing is that ice-cold "Self-destruct sequence activated" female  PA voice in the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999125917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1688491430}

Descent's spiritual successor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141369171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1664859492}
review: I grew up on the original Descent games, and Descent II is my personal favorite. Overload hits all the right notes, from the other-worldly aesthetics to the intricate and cramped level design, plus powerful weapons with the smoothest flight controls around. It's a little harder than the original trilogy at times, but this never detracts from the fun of destroying everything while flying around in every direction. There are 5 difficulties and even the 2nd easiest one (Rookie) can kick your ass at times. 10/10 best 6dof game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021922634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1758, 'last_played': 1601251568}
review:
TLDR: If it goes on sale, buy it. It's fun.

I was a big fan of the Descent franchise, so I really enjoyed Overload.  There honestly isn't a whole lot to the game - fly around, get new guns/missiles, and kill robots.  That's all it really needs to be for Descent fans.  Online play can be fun or really frustrating (if you suck like me) and challenge mode is a blast (it's basically a nonstop gauntlet and your ship powers-up the longer you survive.)  The single-player story was interesting enough for what it was (I mean, your character is a faceless, speechless, nameless pilot that never leaves the confines of his little ship.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197979771585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 7166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1652, 'last_played': 1707594259}
review: Any fans of the original Descent, Descent 2, or Descent 3 will love this game.  It was designed and produced by members of the team that made the original Descent.  It has the same old school feeling of those games with modern graphics, updated gameplay, and other improvements.  You may find yourself addicted to it. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197999885765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1596477489}
review: Overload is a great throwback to an old classic.  That said, even if you are not lucky enough to have played the Interplay releases of Descent, you will find a lot of fun with this title.  Dive right in and experience the simple joys of gaming, as enjoyed by gamers past.  This is a must have in any gamer library.  Good VR support (Rift S)

author: {'steamid': '76561198844415171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 113334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1237, 'playtime_at_review': 24133, 'last_played': 1712446802}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068136497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3068, 'last_played': 1630171762}
review:
Real darn very real good game. It gives you an excuse to bust out the old joystick, and it has excellent ambiance and very fun, very punishing combat. I suggest you crank up the difficulty until you learn to always use all your secondaries. Pleasantly reminescent of Descent while adding very welcome new mechanics. Great challenging 6-DOF action. 

I tried using an old 6-DOF Space Mouse from 3dConnexion, and it's a headache but fun. Amps the challenge nicely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064197340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1578339528}
review: Worst community I've experienced in years.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991245044', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 1054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1682990786}
review:
Honestly, this game is an absolute blast - granted I really only ever played the original Descent, but this brings back all those memories in force.

Everything about this game just speaks to how well polished it is - the difficulty curve is well paced, the upgrades are all meaningful and balanced, and the level design is really top notch.

Honestly, I can't recommend it enough.  Very rarely after beating a game do I go back and play it, but NG+ is calling to me right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058593654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1678267495}
review:
Non giocare ad overload √® un crimini contro il santo gaming!
Ok √® vero...io sono di parte perch√© all'epoca mi sono sparato tutti i tre capitoli originali di descent che all'epoca √® stato a dir poco all'avanguardia. Tuttavia questo 6dof √® veramente ben fatto e penso possa piacere a tutti gli amanti di un qualsiasi fps old school dove si spara e si va avanti senza troppe menate.
La grafica √® gradevole pur non essendo niente di speciale ma quello che funziona veramente bene sono i comandi e il gameplay.
In pratica hanno riprodotto descent al 100% ed √® fantastico!

author: {'steamid': '76561198256020215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1578102877}
review: Authentic Descent experience. Highly recommend playing in VR! Standout sound design and music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066610690', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1577926087}
review:
Review of the VR version of this game:
Pros:
-Fun and unique game play
-Good graphics
-Not overly nauseating for a VR flying game
Cons:
-Keyboard/mouse only.
-The main problem with this game on VR is the extremely cramped levels. You constantly need to make 90 degree turns, and you never seem to be more than 5 feet from a wall. The levels and need to constantly change direction just don't work well on VR. This game could be excellent for VR if the levels were more open. I returned it after trying the first level.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249785994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1710080650}
review: Great sequel to Decent from years ago!  Good game play and a lot of action!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969364916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1695781892}
review:
As a Descent veteran, I'm having a blast. The feel of the movement, level design, and weapons are just right. The soundtrack is spot-on as well. Secret levels are frantic, and that's a good thing! I'd have logged more hours by now for sure 'cept that my joystick hand doesn't have the endurance it used to.

If I could improve one thing, it would be to give each bot a more distinctive sound. I know they've got sounds already, I just have a hard time telling them apart sometimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040827533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1708233031}
review: Great game, great story, great design. Really underrated game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970465924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1577826677}
review:
Experienced on a 9900K, RTX 2080 TI, Valve Index.

As an old timer who cut his teeth on Descent along with Doom, etc., this is the shit in VR and it kills me to put a negative but I want a fix.

My primary complaint, and it's a big one, is the FLASHING BRIGHT WHITE LIGHT that happens all the time. Some of the static lights cause this effect standing still and it happens in combat relatively often but OMFG it's terrible and makes me want to rip the headset off.  I can't believe this was intentional by design.  The effect is jarringly horrible.  DEVS, please fix this crap.  If anyone else has a fix please comment.

If you have any sort of epilepsy, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561199012686621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1603133175}
review:
Played Descent decades ago and loved the game.
Overload creators managed to ressurect the original atmosphere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198385317808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1581903220}
review: As a former Descenter I wanted to give as much back to the original development team as I could.  This game delivers and more.  I especially love the lock down mode they added to the campaign.  I supported the kick starter and have it for both Xbox and PC.  I'm currently playing the PC because I can use my Logitech Extreme 3D Pro with it like the old days with the Microsoft Sidewinder 3D Pro.  It works almost the same.  I love it.  I can't wait to get started on multiplayer and level building.  Koolbear?  Pooterman?  You guys still out there?  Spaz you still building?

author: {'steamid': '76561197971327307', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1605238589}
review: This game is Descent II 2.0. I highly recommend it for old gamers who liked the Descent series or new gamers who want to try a top-notch FPS in 6-degrees of freedom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198871489753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1665105100}
review: True to the letter "Soul successor of the Descent". Kudos to the original makers (of the Descent) on this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076369727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2523, 'last_played': 1708352432}
review:
Descent 4. Looks good, plays even better and the main campaign is what I really wanted from classical Descent games.
Only problem: you need 3rd party tools to play online... Aaand probably there won't be a Overload 2 sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995259232', 'num_games_owned': 3747, 'num_reviews': 341, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1577495812}
review:
The true Descent 3. A perfect recreation of everything that made the first two Descent games amazing, with some seamless modernization. The levels are maze-like and claustrophobic while rewarding attention to detail, the enemies are the classic Descent archetypes, the aesthetic is an almost 1:1 replication, and the 6DoF shooting is as timeless as ever.

Not for those with spatial awareness issues or anxieties. You WILL get lost and you WILL have to learn how to navigate 3D spaces better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064061977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1685750824}
review:
A largely faithful addition to the Descent I & II, with the right amount of the third thrown in. No outside play as far as I've seen, but overall smart AI and challenging maps offering a range of adaptive content. If you enjoyed the free form combat of these early games, you'll appreciate the updated graphics and effects alongside the effective use of mouse and keyboard controls.

A+ stuff. And if anyone ever wants to give Freespace a righteous update - I've got a marvellous pitch. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039843270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1611164834}
review:
I had to write a review right away because I need to share the same good feeling I had with Descent running in my old PC :). 

This is a proper Descent modern sequel. It improved where it was obvious like graphics, effects, interface, modes, etc but kept the awesome soul that every fan has from the old times.

Smooth controls, smart frightening enemies, awesome level design, nice story with exceptional voice-over, lovely powerful weapons.

In short, Overload is the soulful 6DOF FPS everyone needs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014236198', 'num_games_owned': 11, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 51448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 24, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1712441260}
review: Challenging and Fun, good graphics and movement.  Very similar to Descent 3 (which I like very much).

author: {'steamid': '76561198434864713', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1586025430}
review: Amazing game, the movement features are fluid and feel amazing.  The gameplay is a mixture of FPS, adventure and puzzle, each level has a new challenge, with new weapons, new enemies, and more adventure exploration and story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333226366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1608325591}
review: A quand le RTX sur ce jeu ? Top, on retrouve compl√®tement l'esprit Descent. Aucun mal de la VR √† d√©plorer. On retrouve aussi ce bon vieux bot qui nous aide √† trouver notre chemin. L'automap est remarquable. Le graphisme est plut√¥t r√©ussi, sans √™tre transcendant. Je trouve les IA un peu trop faciles, mais je n'ai pas encore test√© les niveaux au dessus de 'fine gachette'... Ca fait plaisir de retrouver ce bon vieux jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105672504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1634486575}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064388679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1577214339}
review:
[h1]"Just like old times Hobbes, huh?"[/h1]

So you think you're a good pilot? Try flying and dogfighting in the tunnels to test your spatial awareness.

Looks like Descent 1, 2 and 3 only better. The guide bot is a hologram this time and called something else. It's better since you can't collide with it not because its name is different.

Easily [b]9/10[/b] on the get go. There's enough graphics options here to suit your PC.

Be prepared to get disoriented and be awed by the level designs. It isn't Descent if you're not confused as to which way to go. Already in the tutorial i seemed to have missed the secret rooms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198979094887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1616449615}
review: Great game!!! I played all the original games back in 9th grade! I loved them then and love it now. Great graphics, interesting, hard and detailed game! Reminds me of when we would stay after school and about twenty of us would play Descent in computer class! It was ahead of its time and will always be a classic! Hope to see more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029698312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1578250718}
review: Its basically Descent from the 90s with better graphics and a nice upgrade-your-ship  feature. So if you liked Descent, youll love this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040857079', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1615170459}
review: Be warned: The game is challenging

author: {'steamid': '76561198061222291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2416, 'last_played': 1618132946}
review: This is the best Descent game since Descent 3!

author: {'steamid': '76561198851608275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2309, 'last_played': 1584886436}
review: This is a really cool flight sim game when playing in VR. Whether playing in flat screen or VR mode it is kinda like the zero G version of Doom where you get the crap scared out of you when you enter a new room or area. Enemies come out to attack while you fly around like a madman firing guns wildly and  trying  not to die or kill yourself with your own rockets. This is one of the best(if not the best) and most complete VR  space flight sims yet. I played this game on original flat screen as Descent and this is so much more fun in VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972274407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1652499356}
review: So much like playing Descent (but with improvements!) that my muscle memory didn't even require any adjustment. Love it! Cool story, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084336854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1691465021}
review: Great key mapping. I like the graphics. Some people say the exploding robots made from missiles are a bit too annoying and should be taken out. I liked how the goblins shot balls in the demo, they seem to have changed the balls to yellow lasers on the middle difficulty and above.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037218545', 'num_games_owned': 1783, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1633144806}
review:
Smells like a brand new car....
This is one of the best experiences in gaming due to the game-play being roughly the same as it was back when it was called Descent by the same developers. Yes, retro gaming, this is from the time when gaming meant the most to the culture I grew up in, when there wasn't a blockbuster movie that could  be connected to or tied into this  type of game, when the direction of the shooter genre as a whole, degraded into its own stupidity and realistic approach because it couldn't compare in function to this type of shooter, where movement, X,Y and Z, expressed  mathematically in true 3D was considered convoluted by the main stream. 

Level Design: I am impressed by these industrial complexes that are structured, with and without symmetry but appear congruent to the method of exploration at a dissident kind of angle, this is the tried and true formula exemplified of grabbing keys, hitting switches and secret hunting in a 3D polygonal area. Zero gravity and 6DoF exploration with one entrance and one exit, maps go vast and deep with twists and ambushes, and one can lose themselves ESPECIALLY in VR here, in the total unknown deep within the crust of some moon there is seldom time to relax.

 Some issues, nothing game-breaking, I became aware that:
It may seem as if the levels keep coming without a difference in color or texture they do seem to run together and might as well be combined together if the story didn't say otherwise also the areas do not penetrate as deep as the experience seems. On a plus note, the endgame has different atmosphere yet same architecture. If the premise was to escape an enormous citadel fortress of mechanical nature from deep within it's depths then we would really have scored due to the mania that the story could assume. Even Descent 3 had differing locations such as a prison and outdoor segments - not so in Overload, each mission has one goal, to Overload the main reactor or a boss fight which there are few, and escape. The levels get better as they get harder and that is the business and always has been.

The team never promised anything really story-wise, but what we got is some technical jargon with nice audio clips provided by survivors we scoop up. The soundtrack can't be beat and is really really really freaking amazing retro-techno that is complimented as the rambunctious orchestra of firepower erupt into grinding metals eclipsed by explosions of light intensity providing  blinding showers of sparks and trails. The artificial intelligence is ruthless, be warned

It is the last of it's kind, Overload is well worth it as an exercise of what it used to be and a retrofitted gem. It looks really crisp with the  explosions going off in the darkness. An arsenal of weaponry to boot, all very different  sounds and looks and even feels, overall very kinetic (and/or claustrophobic).

VR is implemented exceptionally well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198451289639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1687914059}

author: {'steamid': '76561198354545299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1709659993}
review: This is the sequel to Descent you've been wanting since the 90s. A great mix of box world level areas and underground caverns.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991124354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1561745033}
review: Works on WMR but had to refund due to motion sickness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064343208', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1616374944}
review:
I played DESCENT when i was a wee lad, im 28. I feel like i could put my dad infront of this game, and he could play it just from what he might remember of the old game.
This game captures the nostalgia amazingly, looks genuine to its predecessor, and plays really well. It can get overwhelming quickly, but the fun of the 6-degree is you can flip over, and a room that was oddly shaped or had a strange flow can suddenly make sense. super fun retro hud, and a great soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966199013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 6849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6, 'playtime_at_review': 1688, 'last_played': 1711666258}

review: Overload is superb in VR. The immersion is intense and the 6DOF with a gamepad controller will have your endorphins flowing. My only grip is no co-op in Challenge mode which would be awesome to have. 5/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998222501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2426, 'last_played': 1680986531}
review: Some days, you just want to scrap some robots with lasers and rockets.  This Descent successor is a decent vehicle for doing so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059586999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1388, 'last_played': 1607748158}
review: Absolutely fantastic game- they did everything right.  I just wish it had gotten more press so that the multiplayer was more active. But it's the perfect evolution of Descent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997878239', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1575271596}
review: THIS. IS. DESCENT.  In every meaningful way.  A modern updated version of Descent for modern computers, made people people who worked on the original.    I've tried the other 6DOFs on Steam (and other sources), and while some, like Sublevel-Zero are good in their own right, none quite match the feel of the original Descent.  This game is well made and is quite polished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086481602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1578190199}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075194002', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1639017950}
review: I'm about 4-5 levels into the game and so far it's been entertaining. Controls are easy to learn and graphics are decent enough. The story line seems secondary to the gameplay itself and that's OK for me... I play this game just for the shoot 'em up aspect rather than a deep plot. There are plenty of secrets to find on each map and that in itself presents a challenge beyond the many combinations of primary and secondary weapons and enemies you will encounter along the way. The Descent series from the 90's has been born anew with the release of Overload. If you enjoyed that series, you'll certainly enjoy this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970484076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1176, 'last_played': 1597527780}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970097728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 37261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 141, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1712369749}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015890256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1601759824}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052668010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1664306713}
review: It's a lot of fun to play! I like how they remained loyal to the original games, but added just the right amount of novelties to keep game play interesting. A joystick is a must. Love this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968826173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 45, 'playtime_at_review': 3393, 'last_played': 1711316886}
review: Just an excellent 6DOF game. Fantastic modernization of the Descent series. I joined the Kickstarter, had early access and the Dev's delivered on every promise including the release date. Great level and sound design. Tons of graphics and control options. I like the story progression and the tried and true audio presentation method. Higher level Kickstarter investors even got cryo pods. Truly sad that this type of excellence did not perform better in the market place. Too bad other Dev's from Underground didn't just take the money they raised and put it into promotion for this game. A masterpiece and one of my favorite games of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053480449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1660174468}
review:
I bought this game particularly to play it in VR (Oculus) and what a disappointment. The VR support is completely broken with constant crashing and hang ups when launching (in the hour that I've played it, the game has crashed 4 times and hung up at launch at least 6 times). What a missed opportunity! Non VR mode is plagued with micro stutters also so I'm not really enjoying that mode either. They really shouldn't advertise the the game as being VR supported when it's in this state - it feels like just another VR cash grab from the devs. I was so looking forward to enjoying this game.

EDIT: Well, after some tweaking and several hours of play, the game still crashes randomly in VR. I can't go more than 15 or 20 minutes without a freeze or CTD. Only worth it if it was free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198407321934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 257052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155231, 'last_played': 1702167690}
review: This is an absolutely awesome successor to Descent 1,2 & 3 series of 6dof tunnel flyers that many of us played on early office networks in the 90's.   Developed by the original creators of Descent, this spiritual successor brings the game into the modern era of internet gaming with awesome graphics, multiple levels and a large amount of user created content, much of which is free.  Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978439645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1539, 'last_played': 1572464578}
review:
A real Classic in modern Shape!

Overload is an Arcade 6-Axis-Shooter made by the original designers of Descent 1 and 2. Reducing its gameplay to the core, Overload pits you in deep dungeons filled by relentless robots, dangerous traps and countless secrets to be found. Framed by a small story, which reveals via short audio descriptions  scattered around the levels, the player has to fight his way through 15 huge and quite confusing stages. In classical manner you have to find keycards, power-ups, new weapons an ammunition in order to progress.

The smooth graphics bound with a psychedelic, impulsive soundtrack and the fluid controls deliver a fascinating flow. Every inch of this game oozes spirit of its predecessor, and I really enjoyed the action-loaded, unvorgiving, colourful trip, that felt like a time travel back to the golden age of gaming in my youth, where there wasn't any silly trophies, no social awkwardness and not a single uncalled-for stretching mechanic. Just you and the game. Easy as that, how it's supposed to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300853382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1704610350}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029126609', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1570986085}
review:
I really wanted to like Overload but I could not get myself to finish it.

What I do want to clarify is, Overload is a game you can have a lot of fun with. But its also a game that will severely test your patience for bullshit.

First of getting the unimportant stuff out of the way. The story sucks, has a boring villian and is forced in your face way too much. No one cars about Evil Corporation ManMcgee.

The controls are awful for weapon switching often making it tedious to switch your various missile and weapon loadouts. Furthermore the menu UI is uniquely awful. Why is my last save on the bottom of the list and why is restarting the level prioritized? Why would most people want to restart the level first? 

The games hard, which makes the overlong death animations infuriating.  What doesnt help is the various monster closets and cheap ways the game will throw you into the enemy without being able to see them. Hitscan enemies also just blow chode. 

Enviroments are also extremly drab and boring to look at. Doesnt really FEEL like im in a space station or mining colony or whatever. Its all too similar. 

Too many small issues and poorly balanced difficulty add up to a fun but too frustrating experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188625454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1569191577}
review:
(VR Review)
I have an X-Box One X controller and I had to set up everything manually? in 2019?

Everything is too big, the seat of my cockpit could fit 4 people and the controls (flight stick) in the cockpit are 3 feet tall. So I had to turn off the cockpit, but now the immersion is also gone. Not 1:1 scale with the reality makes me sick, it makes me feel like I am having a bad dream. Also there is always bloom everywhere and you cannot turn it off. In VR you are not supposed to be a camera. My eyes don't see bloom in reality. Everything else about the game is amazing. But because I don't play pancake games anymore, I will ask for a refund.

There are a lot of users complaining about the world scale and the DEV  don't do anything. If they ever fix that major immersion and comfort problem, I will buy this game again. For now, it is a refund. Please just add a function to increase or decrease the world scale (the camera distance between the 2 eyes) with a slider or with 2 keys.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970657311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1645990070}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048678654', 'num_games_owned': 1542, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1652458837}
review: A must-have for all the Descent fans out there. Shooting bots (especially with Crusher, a shotgun-like weapon) feels amazing and I can't get enough of it. Enemy AI is challenging - bots run away, ambush the player and dodge attacks. I wish the locations as well as the sound were a bit darker and felt more hostile, though - environments are rather sterile and music lacks Descent's "sinister tinge". One thing I don't really get in terms of design choice here: the design of the enemy bots is outstanding as they look dangerous and simply cool. So why the hell does our poor Kodachi light gunship look like a damn tuk-tuk motorcycle with missile banks welded to it? I'm not saying the game should completely mimic Pyro GX from the Descent series, but I think the "protagonist" ship should definietely look more intimidating and remind less of a utility vehicle. But that's just me; the most important thing is that the game is fun and I can't wait to try it out on VR.

review: This was my first 6dof shooter and I had a great time. I was disoriented at first, but that comes with the territory. I loved being able to boost my way out of tough situations, and the arsenal is great fun to learn and employ. Very fun labyrinthine level design, there was only one level that left a bad taste in my mouth (the one with the teleporters toward the end). All in all a  great project and I'm glad to see that the community is keeping it alive. I'm going to check out the classic Descent titles because of this. Thanks Revival Productions!

review:
Wer fr√ºher Decent geliebt hat, wird Overload lieben.

Ich hab das Game von meinem Bruder geschenkt bekommen mit dem Kommentar, dass es so √§hnlich sein soll wie Decent.

Es ist praktisch gesehen eher ein Remake oder auch eine optisch aufpolierte Version davon, aber nichts desto trotz, ich liebe es.
Die SFX-Sounds, die Gegner und Waffen, Secrets usw. genau wie damals.

Was ich noch wichtig finde dazu zu schreiben, das Spielprinzip ist simpel.
Manche Secrets sind zwar nicht ganz so leicht zu finden, wer allerdings ein komplexes Spiel mit tiefgreifender Story sucht, ist hier falsch. Wer gerne auf unkomplizierte Sci-Fi Shooter steht, wird mit Overload viel Spa√ü haben, auch als Spieler, die Decent nicht kennen.

Nostalgie pur und ganz klare Empfehlung meinerseits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310752398', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1611119400}
review:
As a fan of Descent 1 & 2, I just had to give Overload a try only to find myself rather disappointed. This game is unfortunately plaqued with crashes and lockups that it's not even funny.

Overload has a very bad habit of locking up during the single player campaign loading screens; a fixable problem that by running Overload.exe from the games folder directly) and worst of all, Windows told me :Overload.exe has stopped responding. " after telling the game to QUIT; at this point the game completely locked up tighter than a drum to the point where switching to other applications such as Task Manager was completely impossible without a reboot.

To make matters even worse yet, I've discovered on Discord the game developers had all switched companies so there might just be limited support with the possibility of no game patches to fix these fatal game bugs.

If Steam had a rating system, then I'd rate Overload at 3 for its visually stunning graphics and very good quality sound and it's consuming fatal lockups. At this time, I'm not recommending this game at all!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053575547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1603855046}
review:
A true successor to a descent series! Feels very much like D 1/2.

Combat feels rewarding: crunchy explosions, pieces flies everywhere, no shortage in ammunition encourages to shoot more. Add a good music and you will be sucked in for a good couple of hours before making a break!

Yes, there are already a bunch of games trying to bring back gold old descent-style feeling, but this one is especially good. In my opinion Overload IS better than, let's say, Sublevel Zero and here is why: Overload got fixed hand-crafted levels and some meaningful plot (if someone cares). No questionable procedural s*it. Proper save-load mechanics over permadeath. Well-defined weapons - you don't have to read trough specs and carefully choose which one to keep. Combat is placed above looting.

VR mode:
Most of time played the game in a normal non-vr mode, but the review can't be complete without trying it in VR. I put on my Vive and tried it out. Right away, for some reason, the game hangs on attempt to load a saved game. Finally was able to play after 3rd try. There is absolutely nothing special in VR: yes, you can look around in a cockpit and move your head side to side, but that's it. The controls still mouse + keyboard (or some other non-vr controller if you prefer) and after a while you found yourself keeping head in a fixed spot looking and shooting forward very much like in a regular mode. Except the resolution is much lower, FOV is now limited and locked to match natural FOV of your eyes and visual FXes with A LOT of flickering looks annoying as hell. Especially when you using flare!
After about 5 minutes you completely realizes VR adds literally nothing to the game and even makes it worse in some aspects. It looks and plays better on a decent full-HD monitor and absolutely awesome on 4K.

The good stuff:
+ Fells like descent 1-2
+ Good visuals yet the game is not resource hungry
+ Full-blown single-player campaign with some plot. The plot is of course optional: you can just ignore it and proceed to blow up robots
+ There is MUSIC and voice-acting
+ No procedural-permadeath s*it.

There is also not so good things as well:
- The design of levels/missions feels kinda limited in variations and sometimes lacking details. Many levels feels the same. Level design is behind what we saw in descent-3 and barely stands for today's game industry standards. But still, levels are more interesting than in sublevel-zero.
- Something wrong about guns: a dozen of missions through the game and still didn't saw any vulcan or gauss? The "driller" feels like an oddball - like something B-graded: not fun to shoot. Very few upgrades to a basic "laser". Some guns are basically the same. The same about missiles: feels like game designers where out of ideas after implementing basic "standard missile - homing missile - cluster-mega-badass-missile". Other types of missiles are just variations of those basic types.
- Strange crosshair: no markings indicating the very center, sometimes makes it hard to aim properly. The targets usually not that far away but still - feels like the crosshair is missing the main part.


========

You may want to check the level editor somewhere around.
Worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115089193', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1568577693}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976813814', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1669173689}
review:
I remember playing Descent in the 90's.  That feeling of disorientation, and vertigo, and killer robots!  The level's are unlike anything you've ever experienced with other FPSs, and it can take a little while to adjust to the fact that there isn't really an up or down, and that the path you need to follow might be directly above you.

Overload is a modern version of Descent.  The graphics are fantastic, the game runs super smooth for me, and the level design is mind-bending.  It's very fast paced, and at higher difficulty levels can be very challenging.

It also has some nice quality of life features, like an holographic guide that can help you navigate through the twisted corridors and lead you to your next goal.  This is great for beginners that are still getting used to 6DOF, but vetrans don't need to enable tho guide if they don't want to.

I've only played a couple hours so far, but I'm already really loving the game.  It's a very reasonable price as well.

If you enjoyed Descent, that this is really a no-brainer.  Do yourself a favor and pick this game up, you won't regret it.

Note to Linux users: this game runs excellent on Linux!

OS: Linux (Pop_OS 19.04)
GPU: Nvidia GTX 2070
RAM: 32 GB
CPU: 4 Core / 8 Thread Intel i7

author: {'steamid': '76561198026138231', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1666315410}
review:
Simply put - the undisputed King of the modern day 6DOF games and Descent 4 in all but name (and by the creators of Descent anyway) so anything else just can't match the adrenaline rush this game gives to the player.  Money well spent even at full price.  The BEST 6DOF there is and well worth the wait from Greenlight, EA to final release.  10/10
Graphics and lighting effects are first class and although the engine renders in DirectX 9c it surpasses anything DirectX 11 or 12 with ease.  The soundtrack will have you nodding your head and tapping your feet to the beat.  Yes, I love this game and you will too if you buy it.  I showed support for the devs by purchasing all the extras that if offered up for sale along with the base game.  Overload surpasses Descent 1 and 2 and every other Six Degrees Of Freedom game on the current market.  This is a classic game already and it has a massive cult following.   And just so as you know, Alistair Brimble of Team 17 Alien Breed fame did some of the music tracks.  Of all the games in my Steam library Overload is in the top five alongside Nier Automata and The Witcher 3.  Yep, it is that GOOD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035130011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1562864416}
review:
Tried and test on VR: 1 /10
Flatscreen: estimated: 7-8 /10

Ok I have to thumbdown because it does not deserve a good rating for VR. On flatscreen it's a very good modernization of Descent but I really can't recommend on VR it's tearing my eyes so bad after a small hour I felt so bad I had to put the helmet down. Imagine the combination of fast movements with your body not being involved with a navigation in a very small and closed areas with blank walls everywhere to look at  = vomit simulation 2.0. Not to mention it has poor performances I run it on Nividia 1070 8 GB and sometimes I get plenty of minors but annoying images gliches and the worst thing is the light omg this is just terrible your screen flashes the light from the environment on your whole view for no reason it's clearly the light glitching I am not epileptic but I feel like this is comingvisnjdf√ßovh qujosmfdvnmoijl<sfdn vjmsOVERPRICED!!!d<olfnvOVERPRICEDjopmd<nscvcx<<

But now I can very well remember about Descent, I played it a very long time ago mid 90's, alongside with Commanche (1992). Despite its simple look the campaign is a hooker, the gameplay is simple but you would not ask for anything else, it's a really special game and since all these years I have never seen a copycat of this title or something playing like it. Sometimes it does feel playing an old DOOM or Quake.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993787733', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1308, 'last_played': 1569611186}
review:
It's not just a brushed version of the original. It's much better than the that.
It's that "one more level" kind of game.
As a game developer (not this title), I must admit the hard work that had been put into this one. Respect.
Strongly recommended. This is a must have arcade 3D shooter.

Pros:
graphics/effects are a perfect match in this game
smooth arcade controls
good game mechanics, good weapons/enemies/effects

Weaknesses:
music
no quick load binding - I mean really??

author: {'steamid': '76561197960464457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1574903619}
review: I really wanted to like this game. I'm not a die hard Descent fan by any means, but I remember playing it as a kid and thought this would be some nostalgia fueled fun. I gave up a couple hours into this because I simply wasn't enjoying myself. The combat is frustrating because using those six degrees of freedom effectively is difficult. I'm used to circle strafing, but it seems like this game wants you to sphere strafe. That being said, many of the encounters happen in tight tunnels, so the extra axis of movement doesn't really get you anything other than confusion. It's hard to stay oriented in three space while remembering where the enemies are and reacting to their attacks. Maybe I'm bad or just not in the target market, but I couldn't get into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971423945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1574084984}
review:
I have played the original Descent during my childhood, so this is the standard that I compare this game to.

In terms of level design, weapons, enemies and gameplay, Overload holds up. During the single player campaign, that is; I have not tested multipalyer yet and I don't think I need to.
The graphics of this game are a bit too polished for my taste since the original with its pixel graphics gave me a more raw and untamed impression. Also enemies are not easy to tell apart quickly. In Descent, the enemies were bright orange or grey-red or green while in Overload, color-coding is not strictly enforced.

I am having a very good time, after all, and the game i exactly what I would like it to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044991542', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 959, 'last_played': 1559673589}
review:
Overload is a worthy successor to Descent, but not flawless. Anyone desiring an arcade shooter inspired by 90s game design philosophy should have plenty of fun with this one.

Pros:
- smooth fast-paced action
- nice graphics
- intricate level design with secrets EVERYWHERE
- the story is interesting enough

Cons (pretty much nitpicks):
- certain bots can be hard to tell apart at a first glance
- particle effect overload, I recommend turning them down a bit
- certain secrets are missable (i.e. you do something out of order and you won't be able to open the secret door), but this isn't told to the player, resulting in a bunch of time wasted flying all around the place trying to find a way to open them
- weapon balance could be better, I have used 2 of the earliest guns for 90% of my playthrough

author: {'steamid': '76561198141857466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1637829296}
review:
Daniel Wentz and Jerry Berlongieri did a really good job with the soundtrack (loved their soundtrack from Descent 2 and 3). The only issue that I had that the campaign felt a bit short. I'd really love to see this game get DLC of some sort, more weapons, and a co-op mode.

Definitely a must for your time if you're a fan of the old Descent Series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071401000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1569462784}
review:
----------------------------------------------------
If you've played Descent
----------------------------------------------------
It's literally Descent 4 under a different name, so if you enjoyed the previous games, get this one. New maps, new weapons, new enemies, epic new soundtrack. The graphics aren't as revolutionary as Descent and Descent 3 were for their time, but it gets the job done.

The biggest criticism I can level against it from the perspective a Descent veteran is that it doesn't evolve the formula a lot. It's a pretty "safe" game from the perspective of, it didn't try anything really outside the box from previous games in the series: It's still a linear string of missions with a few secret levels on the side, it's still you against world, it's it's still a matter of finding and blowing the reactor then finding the escape tunnel.  It would have been nice to see them try something like adding allies, strategic/resource-management gameplay, an overworld, dynamic loot, etc etc. The most significant addition is the upgrade points system which.... It's not *bad*, but they don't let you reassign points or really specialize into any one area. There's only 2 upgrade levels per system and if you explore levels thoroughly you'll get a ton of upgrades, so there's really no concept of replaying the campaign over with different a different loadout e.g. specifically a cannon sniper, or a missile boat, or a minelayer.


----------------------------------------------------
If you have not played Descent
----------------------------------------------------
This is a "6 degrees of freedom" game (6DOF), where you pilot a space ship through zero-gravity environments. You can yaw, pitch and roll like an aircraft, move backward and forward, and also slide laterally up/down or left/right.  Getting used to the controls might take a little but, the smooth flight physics and total freedom makes just getting around the levels feel enjoyable in itself.

You'll pick up a variety of primary weapons (machine guns and laser type things) and secondary weapons (rockets, missiles and bombs) and be able to use both of these simultaneously. Secondary weapons tend to pack a big punch but ammunition is fairly limited, while your primaries use energy or bullets which are plentiful. Each weapon is aimed at specific tactical scenario, and learning to quickly recognize the best weapon for a given situation and deploy it is key.

Levels are large and complicated. The 6DOF flight model means that you will be twisting and turning in every direction. Levels usually have a general sense of "this way up",  but doors and hallways will often split off at all kinds of crazy directions. There is an auto map feature in the game to help you find your way around by showing you where you  have been and where you have not, and there's also a friendly guide bot that can lead you. So navigating the levels requires some lateral thinking but are not intended to literally be mazes.

Enemies? There's lots of enemies to shoot at. The story is the classic AI-gone-rogue horror show, where all of the machines meant to build, mine, and defend the space colonies have gone haywire and now attack you on sight. There's a good variety of different robots, which though they kind of look similar, have very different weapons and tactics. Some robots are relatively stupid and just lumber in your general direction firing off plasma cannons, while other robots are weak and sneaky and like to shoot missiles at you while your back is turned then run away.  There's even melee robots that will rush at you and try to dismantle your ship with buzz saws and giant claws. Robots are generally smart, challenging, and you'd swear they are actually working together sometimes....

author: {'steamid': '76561198019259546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 24108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17773, 'last_played': 1697898597}
review:
From the creator of the 'Descent' series comes a new title for those who love to strafe in all directions while they eviscerate enemies with all manner of matter & missile weaponry.

Tricording, twirling, spinning, rotating, dancing around the enemies of alien cave networks is still the only way to fly.
But make sure you upgrade right; Choose your play style before you enter the caves in a set of challenge maps that'll pit you against most of what you'll face in the story. A story about a diabolical plot involving mankinds' struggle against...against bots...and more?. ;)

Watch for easter eggs of the genre/'previous' titles.

Music didn't stand out as previous 'Descent' soundtracks have. (They're top 10 favorite game soundtracks of mine.) I my binging on Perturbator, & Lazerhawk, & Mick Gordon, & the like, has made me think it should be played everywhere. Who am I kidding? It should. It's a different sound, not bad, but different. Perhaps tied into the as yet unacknowledged growth of the story into, I suspect, something...familiar. ;) Only reason this comparison is made is because so many of the 'Descent' creators made this game.

For 6 degrees of freedom accept no substitute.
Except for maybe, a sequel. Which I eagerly await.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960775892', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2421, 'last_played': 1651849443}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980952499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1627152977}
review:
If you liked the Descent series, you'll probably like this a lot more than the vaporware "Descent prequel" by the Star Citizen devs.

However, I have two complaints:

In challenge mode, you have to unlock the highest difficulty FOR EACH LEVEL INDIVIDUALLY by getting a really high score on the highest normal difficulty on that level. On top of that, there's an achievement for reaching that score on lower difficulties, and you DON'T automatically get it for reaching the score on higher ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1560286220}
review:
Das Spiel ist mittelpr√§chtig.

Es ist ein Arcade-artiger 6DOF-Shooter, eine Art Remake von Descent aus dem Jahr 1995, das durch seine eing√§ngige Steuerung im gravitationslosen 3D-Raum beeindrucken kann.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1767571284

Unsere Aufgabe in den sich √§hnelnden Leveln ist (soweit ich das gesehen habe), mit unserem Fahrzeug Stationen von Feinden zu s√§ubern und einen bestimmten Zielpunkt zu erreichen, meist um dann die Station zu sprengen und zu verschwinden. Auf unserem Weg m√ºssen wir gewisse Objekte einsammeln, um Zugang zu anderen Bereichen zu erlangen. Andere Objekte stocken unsere Vorr√§te an Munition und Energie wieder auf. Weitere Objekte erm√∂glichen uns den Zugang zu geheimen Kammern, die wiederum etwas f√ºr uns bereit halten.

Die K√§mpfe sind nicht so schwierig. In bisher unerforschten Bereichen lauern sie auf dich. Einige kommen kamikazartig auf dich zu, andere feuern auf dich, sobald sie dich entdeckt haben. Das ist nicht hochkompliziert und insofern vielleicht nur eine Weile unterhaltsam.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1767570051

Das alles ist nicht spektakul√§r aber nett gemacht. An sich ein rasanter Shooter, Action pur mit entsprechend fetziger Musik. Allerdings sind die Stationen geradezu Labyrinthe, in denen man sich verirren kann, weil alles sich irgendwie √§hnelt und weil man wegen der Bewegung im 3D-Raum oft nicht mehr weiss, wo "oben" und "unten" ist. In den ersten Leveln ging es dennoch noch recht gut, aber dann habe ich viel zu oft die Orientierung verloren und irrte ewig lange durch leere Korridore umher, nur um herauszufinden, wo es weitergeht.

Die 3D-Karte, die man aufrufen kann, ist ganz OK, obwohl es immer etwas dauert, die aktuelle Ausrichtung des Fahrzeuges mit der Ausrichtung der Karte zu koordinieren, um sich zu orientieren, aber sie zeigt NICHT an, wo es lang geht. Vielleicht ist das Absicht, aber dann geht mir das gegen den Strich. Stirbt man doch mal, kann man den ganzen Level √ºbrigens neu beginnen. So habe ich den Phoebe-Komplex x-mal probiert, bis es mir wirklich Oberkante Schnauze stand, durch die leeren G√§nge zu streunern. Ein einfacher Wegweiser, im HUD oder in der Karte w√§re ein Segen gewesen.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1767569701

Die Grafik ist relativ gut, die Gegner, die Sch√ºsse alles ganz nett gemacht, aber die Umgebung ist √ºberaus eint√∂nig.

Der Sound ist nett, vor allem mit wummernder Musik und kr√§ftigen Ger√§uschen f√ºr Sch√ºsse und Explosionen.

Die Steuerung mit dem Gamepad ist sehr gut. Ich war erstaunt, wie gut die Steuerung im 3D-Raum funktioniert.

Pro & Contra:

+ Arcade-artige Shooter-Action
+ Gelungene 6DOF-Steuerung

o Labyrinth-artige Umgebung

- Repetitive Umgebung und Abl√§ufe
- Keine Zielwegweiser
- Daher (sp√§ter, evtl.) langes Umherirren auf der Suche nach der Fortsetzung

Wertung: 5/10

Das Umherirren, wenn man nicht weiss, wo es weiter geht, nimmt dem an sich rasanten Spiel f√ºr mich jedweden Spa√ü. Ein Arcade-Shooter mit Desorientierungsklotz am Bein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035494178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1656167220}
review:
This is how you do a Spiritual Successor.
For those of you who played Descent, this was developed by the original developers, and it shows.

If you've never played this type of game before the controls will take some practice, but hang in there for a bit and you'll be surprised how quickly you catch on.  Once you do gain a basic understanding of the control scheme, this game handles like butter.

11/10 for sound and graphics, I am in love with the synthwave-esque sound track, it compliments the frantic gameplay very well.  It's shocking that the graphics in this game were developed by such a small team, they give AAA games a run for their money.  Not to mention the lighting effects, which I'm normally not one for noticing these sorts of things, but they are incredible.

The gameplay is, however, where this game truly shines.  As I stated, the gameplay is an improved version of descent in every possible way (for those unfamiliar, think like an old school arcade style shooter like Doom or Quake, but with an extra degree of movement.  So, in essence you are floating in the air and can move up and down like you would normally move forward/backward/left/right).  
     The single player campaign is excellent, with a large variety in each level, and tons of secrets and power-ups to find.  Unlike Descent, you will be able to spend your power-up points to permanently upgrade your ship, which adds an interesting element of replayability.  
     There is a multiplayer mode, I haven't played very much of it, but from what I've heard it is very smooth.  
     The final mode is Challenge mode, which is a horde like gametype where you try to survive as long as possible against wave after wave of increasingly difficult enemies.  This is my favorite mode, and is a good way to hone your skills if you needs some practice with the controls.

The only thing I think that could improve this game is if they allowed the campaign to be played co-operatively.

I really think the devs poured their heart and soul into this game, they knocked it out of the park in every area.  I would definitely recommend this title to anybody who wants a quality game with addictive gameplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198031621784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1704661901}
review:
Rating: 5/10

It's Descent in a good and bad way. Overload is as we remember Descent with our nostalgia glasses on.

The gameplay has not changed much, so it has the same feeling as Descent,
but the game does not feel fresh at least to Descent veterans.
Everything here feels too familiar and the story could not be less interesting.
Sometimes we load up an old game to find out why we uninstalled it.
And so it is with Overload. It feels as if we have played the game already. So I am a bit disappointed. And my motivation to complete Overload is at a low point.

However the graphics are smooth, the weapons are a blast, the controls are perfect.
And to my knowledge there is still no other game that achieved the same as Descent,
though there are some cheap clones who tried to copy it's gameplay.
And when I now see a video of Descent I can hardly go back to those graphics after Overload is here.

After giving Overload a second try I am even more bored. I had to disable the (heavy metal like) soundtrack. The unforgetable original midi soundtrack was much cooler. The story is not only boring but annoyingly boring with bad voice acting, disturbing a potential flow. 
The first level does not even have a reactor to blow up, just terminate every enemy and getting beamed out. Enemies and enviroments look great but samey.
The levels are not immersive (no sense of a real place like a mining station).
So this is maybe fun for multiplayer or VR, but I have no more desire to play this as a singleplayer game without VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963660521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1538698766}

review: Overload is a name I don't see brought up very often when folks discuss Brand New 90s-Style FPS Games. And that's a shame, because this is like the Descent sequel we would never have otherwise gotten, with a bunch of its own new takes to make things interesting. Please buy it, it's awesome, the survival mode is really fun, it looks fantastic, the explosions are really satisfying, just...buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965670024', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1705859762}
review:
This is -exactly- the kind of experience you want from a 6DOF shooter. Immersive world, spot on controls, and huge replay both offline and online. I used to play Descent 2 like crazy with the D2X source port until I got my hands on this title.

The game is an absolute black in VR (playing with an Oculus Rift) and setting up control with my Thrustmaster T16000.M HOTAS (w/ rudders) was a total breeze with calibration.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991347543', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1655755370}
review:
I'll start by saying i'm ashamed to admit i had no idea this game came out. i didn't hear about the kickstarter, the production or anything about it. The first game i played on my dad's first computer (IBM aptiva 100mhz pentium 16 mb RAM), was DESCENT, or at least a freeware version of it, i went on to buy the full game, and the sequel DESCENT II which i think i never completed. i've probably bought them each again twice on various platforms. 

i remember spending hours exploring the tunnels of descent, jumping when those clawed slasher bots snuck up behind me. and giggling like a child (because i was a child 20+ yrs ago) when i dropped an earthshaker on a single drone. just because overkill. 

I hope to see sequels, lots of them. this game is everything i wished Descent 3 was back in the day, except prettier. its a modernized Descent, but the flight mechanic and combat are true to their roots, lots of low velocity projectiles, defensive flying. interesting weapons. the creators didn't forget anything that made the original games great/iconic. 

so far so good. still hoping to find an earthshaker missile. i'm only a few missions in but i can se this becoming one of my favorite titles. i hope the team at descendent studios is paying attention, admittedly their game was looking prettier than this, last time i played it, but if the gameplay isn't as good as this, everyone will know the real successor to the Descent legacy is Overload.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206999976', 'num_games_owned': 1110, 'num_reviews': 510, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1551002776}
review:
[h1]Review zu Overload[/h1]

Overload ist ein Spiel, bei dem man wahrlich nicht wei√ü, wo oben und unten ist, da man st√§ndig ein Gef√§hrt steuert, dass sich mit Hilfe einer Drehung die Decke zum Boden machen kann und umgekehrt. (Simpel gesagt, man dreht eine Kamera.)
Und da f√§ngt auch schon meine erste [i]Warnung[/i] zum Spiel an. [b]Wer, bei zu viel Bewegung, schnell mal unter Schwindel leidet, sollte lieber die Finger vom Spiel lassen![/b]
Overload ist mit seinen engen durchfliegenden Korridoren, auch eine recht klaustrophobische Erfahrung, weshalb bei mir stets der Wunsch aufkam, dass das Spiel mich irgendwann mal doch im Weltraum spielen lassen w√ºrde und nicht immer in engen G√§ngen. Leider ist mir dieser Wunsch verwehrt geblieben.
Irgendwann wird das Spiel auch mal repetitiv. St√§ndig auf Drohnen einzuballern macht halt nur bedingt Spa√ü und das auch nur f√ºr eine kurze Zeitdauer.
Und dennoch. Diese kurze Zeitdauer, bevor das Spiel irgendwann repetitiv geworden ist, ist der Grund, warum ich das Spiel letztendlich empfehle.
Spiele wie Doom, Serious Sam, oder auch Overload sind einfach so simpel im Design, dass es irgendwann einfach unumg√§nglich ist, Langeweile zu versp√ºren, aber bis es soweit war, hatte ich stets viel Spa√ü mit dieser Art von Spiel!
Wer also kurzen, aber vergn√ºglichen Ballerspa√ü haben m√∂chte, ist hier also genau richtig! Wenn man es auch nur auf eine halbe Stunde pro Tag verteilt, da sonst das Spiel an einem zerren k√∂nnte.

Kommen wir f√ºr die Schnellen unter uns einfach mal zur Pro-Contra-Liste:

[u][b]Pro:[/b][/u]

+ Grafikm√§√üig hat Overload einiges zu bieten. Lichteffekte und Reflexionen im Allgemeinen haben mich von ihrer Sch√∂nheit fast schon geblendet!
+ Die Musik strotzt nur so vor Energie! Jedoch habe ich mich irgendwann selbst dabei ertappt, dass ich ihn irgendwann schlichtweg √ºberh√∂rt habe
+ Beeindruckende Optionsm√∂glichkeiten. Da l√§sst sich beinahe alles N√∂tige einstellen
+ Auch wenn die Geschichte f√ºr mich belanglos war, so haben wenigstens die Synchronsprecher sich M√ºhe gegeben, sie etwas interessanter r√ºberzubringen
+ Das Spiel ist recht gut optimiert worden. Ich konnte alles auf Ultra ohne Probleme spielen
+ Secrets sind ziemlich gut versteckt und haben immer wieder Freude gebracht, sofern man eines finden konnte. Allerdings hatte ich mit den Secrets auch so meine Probleme (siehe Contra)
+ Mir hat es irgendwie gefallen, dass jede Mission mit einer Zerst√∂rung endete
+ Die automatische Verbesserung von Upgrades war, fand ich jedenfalls, ein interessantes Feature. Das habe ich noch nirgends irgendwo gesehen
+ Das Item [i]Tarnung[/i] ist zwar so gestaltet worden, wie man es erwartet, dass die KI meinen Standpunkt nur kennt, wenn ich schie√üe und dementsprechend auf meine vermutete Position schie√üt, allerdings fand ich das total geil, wenn ich so die KI ausgetrickst hatte. Hat wirklich Spa√ü gemacht!

[u][b]Contra:[/b][/u]

- Es ist ziemlich unbefriedigend, wenn man ein Secret gefunden hat, aber die T√ºr dazu verschlossen ist und man erst noch einen Knopf, oder dergleichen zerschie√üen muss, um hinein zu gelangen. Oft habe ich mir dann selbst gesagt, dass es das einfach nicht wert sei
- Die Geschichte ist absolut belanglos. Klar, ein solches Spiel kauft man sich nicht wegen der Geschichte, aber ich m√∂chte es dennoch mal erw√§hnt haben
- Im Verlauf des Spiels macht man oftmals so ziemlich das gleiche. Man findet Schl√ºssel zu Sicherheitszug√§ngen, stets von Level 1 bis 3, zerst√∂rt einen Reaktor oder rettet Crewmitglieder und flieht dann. Da h√§tte wirklich Abwechslung reingeh√∂rt. Im Allgemeinen √§ndert sich im Laufe der Kampagne stets die Karte und erst gegen Ende wurde von dieser Formel endlich mal abgewichen

[u][b]Prontra:[/b][/u]

+- Hier und da, habe ich Rechtschreibfehler in der √úbersetzung gefunden
+- Vor lauter Explosionen kann es mal vorkommen, dass man Gegner manchmal nicht sieht
+- Die Gegner-KI ist nicht wirklich die Beste. Beispielsweise scheint sie damit gelegentlich √ºberfordert zu sein, mir durch T√ºren zu folgen
+- Der Ladebildschirm h√§tte etwas besser gestaltet werden k√∂nnen

Overload kann man sich mal zulegen, wenn man mal wieder den Drang zu ballern hat. Allerdings w√ºrde ich dies zu einem Sale empfehlen. Overloads Kampagne ist schnell durchgespielt und ich bezweifle, dass das Gameplay mich noch an der Stange halten wird, um vorschnell zur√ºckzukehren und mehr zu spielen.

Ich danke f√ºrs Lesen und w√ºnsche sehr viel Spa√ü beim Spielen! ;-)

https://store.steampowered.com/app/448850/Overload/
