author: {'steamid': '76561198080164938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1531844884}
review: Okay I love it, I even like the challenge mode which is normally a cop out for lazy games with no story!  It has all the feel of the original Descent good voice acting even though I don‚Äôt think the story is all that, it still is interesting.  The ship upgrade system in cool and keeps you looking for secret hidy holes.  I would buy DLC which is another NO NO in my book but as the game good and is reasonably priced, so I would defiantly give it a go.  Thanks to the developers who ported the game to Linux where it runs flawlessly on highest settings and the main reason why I bought the game.  As I only purchase games that port to Linux!  Great game a definite must have in your library, cant wait for some multi player!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070816265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 10638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1711666656}
review:
Overload isn't just a spiritual successor to Descent.  It's [i]better[/i].  Because this is how your imagination remembered Descent.  Beyond the pixels and low-poly robots, there was a [i]feeling[/i].  A feeling of diving headfirst into dangerous mines to blast away at cunning robot adversaries, dodge countless projectiles, destroy reactors, and get out before the whole thing blew up.

20 years later, we have the power to bring [i]that[/i] version to life.  And let me tell you, it is glorious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200096482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1572, 'last_played': 1699920916}
review: Looks fantastic, plays fantastic, has an entrancing story and fun game modes - a definite hit for all fans of early Descent games. I'll be playing this for months to come!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999291704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1586200156}
review: I haven't played the original 'descent' but I still enjoy overload without nostalgia.  This game is great fun and probably one of the best shooters I've played, the controls are easy to learn and hard to master and there's a difficulty level for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974947671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1563617584}
review:
Naturally, being a huge fan of Descent (if it isn't obvious by my Steam name and avatar), I had to pick up this game. 
 First impressions: This game is fantastic!  From the very first fight I was blown away by how good the game looks and feels.  The environments, lighting, and particle effects are beautiful and smooth.  The weapon sound effects really give punch to each weapon.  The audio guys have given us yet another killer soundtrack.  If you loved Descent, you will love this game.  Even if you've never played Descent you will love this game!  This is a refreshing title and exactly what we needed in a market flooded with survival/battleground games.  Kudos to Mike and Matt for giving us old-school 6DOF fans another great gaming experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995210047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1643238334}
review:
Overload is an old-school gamer's dream come true: a modern remake of Descent, by none other than the original creators themselves. This is everything I could have wanted from a modern remake of Descent. HARD, addicting and deep. This game isn't a simple nostolgia cash-in. It's a full-blown love letter to the 6 DOF genre, crafted with care. 

Like Descent 1 and 2, this game is claustrophobic and disorienting. You can never know when a robot is hiding around a corner, waiting to ambush you. 

The AI behaves intelligently, not simply flying straight at you, they will dodge your shots and missles, and some robots will retreat to get a better angle and hopefully suprise you around another corner, or play chicken behind a pillar before popping off a few shots and hiding again. The AI doesn't do the same thing each time, even when reloading from a quicksave. They will try out different tactics. It feels very dynamic.

Playing on Ace (second hardest difficulty), I had to replay some sections dozens of times, and I've only played the first few levels so far. The difficulty is insane and I love it.

This game expands on the Descent formula with an upgrade system. You find upgrade points hidden throughout the levels and use them to upgrade your weapons and abilities between missions. I like this system even better than the old way of just finding every upgrade, since you can choose what to upgrade.

If you get tired of exploring the maze-like campaign levels, you can hone your combat skills 
in Challenge mode, surviving against increasingly difficult waves of robots. There are leaderboards and you can easily see your rank after each round. You'll find youself saying "just one more try.. I was so close to 100,000 points.."

I haven't tried the mutiplayer PVP mode yet, that's next on my list.

The game plays beautifully with a joystick, for old purists like me. The control options are extensive and will cover any setup you have. Every key can be rebound, joysticks have deadzone and sensitivity options, and you can even adjust the response curves for keyboard presses and mouse movement.

The graphics straddle a line between simplistic and realistic. Overall I think they look great, especially the particle effects. Showers of sparks and smoking bits of robots go shooting off in every direction. It's satisfying just to play the game and watch it all unfold.

I highly recommend this game to Descent fans, fans of sci-fi action games, or just fans of games that are hard, fun and replayable. It's a very addicting and well-tuned formula. There's honestly nothing about this game that I dislike.

I do have a wishlist: co-op would be amazing, to play with a friend through the campaign levels. I'd also really like to see some of the classic Descent 1 and 2 levels ported over to this game. Word is the devs might be working on just that.. crossing my fingers we see it soon!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024939249', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1695673081}
review: Polished, gripping, and all-around a pleasure to play. This is truly a worthy successor to the Descent franchise.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970142199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1537608894}
review: Il n'y a pas de doute, on sent que ce sont bien les d√©veloppeurs originel de Descent qui sont derri√®re ce jeu car j'ai retrouv√© exactement les m√™mes sentations, le m√™me feeling du vaisseau que dans les premiers Descent. Un style de jeu que je n'esperait plus voir revenir et cela me fait sacr√©ment plaisir!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970516076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1577081701}
review: So far it is really well done.  It looks and sounds great.  The controls are nice, and the difficult settings are suitably challenging.  It easily seems well worth the modest price to buy this game if you ever played and liked Descent, you will probably like this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014496614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 43944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1846, 'last_played': 1698699159}
review:
Conceptually, Overload is a first-person tunnel shooter with no gravity, kind of like Doom except the floor and ceiling don't really matter. But at its heart, Overload really just seems to be about blowing stuff up.

It's an incredibly... well... crunchy game. A good selection of weapons, but not too many, all of which result in delightfully satisfying explosions when applied to the robotic minions you'll encounter around every corner. It's not the usual experience I expect from an indie developer, and it's really hard to get bored of.

On top of that, the campaign is pretty well-executed too. It's fairly long, but not too long - five to ten hours, probably, depending on your play style - and what seems like a fairly ho-hum plot at first began to draw my attention by the end. The minimalistic (but nonetheless voiced) cutscenes, briefings and in-game dialogue make the game's budget more obvious but they made good use of what they could afford.

Once you get to the end of that, if you're not done blowing stuff up, you can move into Challenge Mode, which is basically an endless zombie-survival kind of game where the objective is to score as high as possible and climb up the leaderboards, or multiplayer where you can choose between free-for-all, head-to-head and team game modes. Both options are considerably tougher than the main game, so I'd recommend tackling them later to most people - you'll need to have well-practiced 6DOF flying skills for best results.

Unfortunately, there is no co-operative multiplayer mode, at least not for the time being - that's probably the most glaring omission in Overload. A capture-the-flag mode might not have gone astray either. But there's still easily enough on offer for the game to be worth playing.

Overall - considering the spotty track record of indie/self-published games, the professionalism Revival displays in Overload is pretty remarkable. Even if 6DOF isn't your cup of tea, they've shown they're a studio worth watching in future.

(Some disclosure stuff - I'm a KS backer for the game and have played it in the ball-park of 50 hours pre-release.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197984671963', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2188, 'last_played': 1624436388}
review:
I've been waiting for a game like this for a very long time. Feels very much like the classic Descent 1-2 that we all loved, while bringing it to a whole new level for modern gamers. Graphics are really good. Some may think the levels are a bit plain, but that is to keep gameplay clean so that your ship doesn't try to catch on every single object in-game. The music tracks are great, the dynamic lighting feels very real in the mines just looks great. The campaign is a joy to play.

The multiplayer is also really fun as a whole and feels pretty well balanced. The only problem for now would be a lack of game modes, which, if the game can get more players interested in multi, we will hopefully see more modes. A level editor is also on the way, which will change the multiplayer experience for the better, since there will always be new levels to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289366141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 14, 'playtime_at_review': 4870, 'last_played': 1711566066}
review:
Jotkut teist√§ ovat saattaneet joskus ys√§rill√§ pelata DOS-peli√§ nimelt√§√§n Descent, tai kenties ehk√§ Descent II:sta. N√§m√§ niin sanotut 6DOF-pelit olivat jonkin hyvin lyhyen aikaa muotia. Descent on kuitenkin nyt vihdoin palannut, ja sen takana olleen Parallax Softwaren perustajat ovat perustaneet nyt uuden pelistudion ja tuoneet oman pelins√§, Overloadin, markkinoille.

Overload jatkaa kahden Descent-pelin muistoa ja tekee siit√§ niin paljon paremman. Nykylaitteistoa hy√∂dynt√§en grafiikoista ja etenkin r√§j√§hdyksist√§ on tehty upeita. Musiikista vastaavat my√∂skin tutut nimet, ja niiss√§ ei ole yht√§√§n mit√§√§n moitittavaa (soundtrack kannattaa siis ehdottomasti hankkia pelin mukana).

Olisihan se tietenkin kamalaa, jos peli itse ei olisi huvittava pelata, mutta se kuitenkin on, ja se on aivan mahtava. Ohjaimet toimivat jopa pelk√§ll√§ n√§pp√§imist√∂ll√§kin upeasti, vaikkakin hiirell√§ pelaamista suositellaan, sill√§ se kasvattaa tarkkuutta huomattavasti. Tasot ovat suuria, monipuolisia ja niist√§ l√∂ytyy aina lis√§√§ tutkittavaa, onhan ne pullollaan salaisuuksia Descent-pelien tapaan. Runsas ase- ja vastustajavalikoima vain tekev√§t pelist√§ entist√§ maukkaamman, ja aseen joutuu valitsemaan yleens√§ tilanteesta riippuen (vaikka yhdell√§ aseellakin p√§rj√§√§, se ei ole aina viisain strategia).

Jos t√§m√§ ei viel√§ riitt√§nyt, Descent-peleihin verrattuna uutta on se, ett√§ alusta sek√§ sen aseistusta voi p√§ivitt√§√§. Pitkin tasoja sek√§ salaisia alueita l√∂yt√§√§ pisteit√§, joilla voi ostaa alukseensa parannuksia tasojen v√§lill√§. Jokaisen aseen voi p√§ivitt√§√§ kahdesti, ja toisella p√§ivityksell√§ on aina kaksi eri vaihtoehtoa.

Peliss√§ on jopa Challenge Mode, er√§√§nlainen selviytymistila, miss√§ pelaaja suljetaan pienemp√§√§n tasoon ja pistet√§√§n vastaan loputtomia m√§√§ri√§ vihollisia. Se on mahtava ty√∂kalu taistelutaitojen ja lent√§misen harjoitteluun, ja jos kilpailumielt√§kin on, voi kilpailla tulostaulun huipulla olemisesta.

Kaiken p√§√§lle peliss√§ on t√§ll√§ hetkell√§ hieman pettymyksen tuottava moninpeli (jota tullaan parantamaan vastaisuudessa, etenkin konsolijulkaisujen my√∂t√§) sek√§ tasomuokkain, jonka avulla voi itse tehd√§ peliin omia lis√§tasojaan. Kaiken kaikkiaan peli on aivan mahtava pakkaus ja on todellinen jatko-osa Descentille.

Suositteluni t√§h√§n peliin kohdistuu Descentin faneille mutta my√∂s FPS-pelien sek√§ toimintapelien faneille yleens√§kin. Kokeile vaikka ilmaista demoa ja siirry sitten kokoversioon - sen voi taata ettet tule pettym√§√§n.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011513057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1568938336}
review: Feels as good to play as Overwatch and Rocket League.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010728314', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1695351119}
review:
The original Descent was slightly before my time and I only played a little bit of Descent II before Descent 3 came out which I played extensively in pug games and D3TL. This game is Descent through and through. However if you preferred the improvements that were made to D3 over D2 like larger levels and varied environments and an overall faster pace, you're going to be disappointed. Anyone calling this game Descent 4 is sadly mistaken, it's nothing like what Descent 4 would have been, it's strictly a Descent 2 reboot. Even with the updated graphics the game still feels dated to me. The ships are blocky flying microwaves that look even less flightworthy than the originals. The weapons are alright I guess, but none of them give me the satisfaction I got from 3-shotting someone from 150 yards away with the Mass Driver.

All that said, Overload is still a really solid spiritual successor to Descent. I totally get that it wasn't trying to be Descent 4 or expand on things from Descent 3, It's stictly a Descent 1 and 2 clone, and if you loved those games you'll probably love Overload. 

8/10 - Descent 3 itch not scratched for me

author: {'steamid': '76561197977184105', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1659106047}
review:
Its all here- mines to get lost in, hordes of bots to blow up, secrets to find, heavy soundtrack, and of course big huge guns and missiles everywhere. 
It may have a different name now, but you better still prepare for descent...

author: {'steamid': '76561198400727891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1528594846}

developer_response:
Jeffromg -- I'm sorry Overload did not work for you.  We have not seen a report like this before, so wondering if you could provide any more information so we can fix this.  Could you tell us your video card and what version of the drivers you have installed?

Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993548395', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 175571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1117, 'playtime_at_review': 5144, 'last_played': 1712446162}
review:
Super actionreich mit genialer 6DOF Flugimulation.

Nachtrag nach >2 Jahren:
Mein Genre ist der Multiplayer, und von Descent3 kommend hatte ichmich darauf auch gewaltig gefreut. Leider hatten die Entwickler ausgerechnet da "kein gl√ºckliches H√§ndchen", um es mal freundlich auszudr√ºcken.

ABER!!! einige f√§hige Leute aus der Community haben das scheinbar Unm√∂gliche geschafft!

Es gibt ein Update f√ºr OVL auf steam zu Vers. 1.1, in der das katastrophale Matchmaking deaktiviert ist und statt dessen der Weg der Community vorgeschlagen und m√∂glich gemacht wird.

Auf der Seite tracker.otl.gg ist ein Gamebrowser und die n√∂tigen Hinweise zu OLMOD. OLMOD ist  ein Tool welches in das Hauptverzeichnis von OVL entpackt wird. OVL wird ab jetzt NUR NOCH √ºber OLMOD.exe gestartet.

Ab sofort gibt es dann im Spiel einen Serverbrowser, hier kann man Spielen beitreten bzw. selber MP-Spiele starten und das dann auch mit Community-Leveln, die um L√§ngen besser und mehr sind als die wenigen Maps der Entwickler.

Achtet darauf dass die Option "Join in progress" aktiviert ist, sonst bleibt ihr alleine im Level ;-)

Um sicher zu sein, nehmt einfach die Option "Public Anarchie" - dort sind die richtigen Optionen voreingestellt.

Okay .. dann VIEL SPASS und willkommen im OVERLOAD Multiplayer

author: {'steamid': '76561198078825817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1546611989}
review:
It's  modern descent successor - it's as disorientating as the original and really well made ;)

About 4GB of content... really, I didn't expect this and was expecting something of the size of original Descent ;)

Works on Linux without any need for workarounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968078659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1536677371}
review: Takes me back to the good old days when I had decent reflexes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032700768', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1645847980}
review: It truly is incredible

author: {'steamid': '76561198001152564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1529345376}
review:
Well...so far those pesky robots keep blowing me up! I was never very good at Descent either but these machines-gone-haywire have clearly had their AI upgraded.

Early impressions: Great gameplay, shiny graphics, and rocking music - a worthy spiritual successor to the defining 6DOF game series of the 90s - with some nice modern touches. If you liked Descent (especially D1 and D2) then it's a sure bet you'll like this - if you didn't or aren't familiar with 6DOF games then you can always try the teaser demo first. It might take a bit of getting used to!

Now...where's that dang reactor...

author: {'steamid': '76561197989535096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 2619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1640641048}
review:
Awesome game, even Rookie is challenging. The controls are amazing, as are the visuals and sounds/soundtrack. Just like Descent and Foresaken, it has tonnes of secrets to find by shooting stuff and there's loads of pick-ups and power ups. There are a lot of game modes challenges and leaderboards with multiplayer,  though I haven't tried most yet. They seemed to have thought of everything and given us a complete game. Easy recommend.
And I believe my review made it turn to Overwhelming :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197970439682', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1685297985}
review:
Super rad. The game is billed as "from the creators of Descent", but realistically this is Descent in everything but name. If you've ever, in your whole life, thought "man, I'd sure love to play a modernized, improved, well-designed version of Descent", then stop what you're doing, hit 'Add to Cart', and just buy the damn thing.

It's a crazy, disorienting, adrenaline-fueled party. This is for Descent what Doom 4 was for the original Doom. It's an improvement in every possible way, and doesn't have a bunch of unnecessary nonsense to slow it down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025009669', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1685573482}
review: Fantastic game, lots of fun and great with vr or without.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024249192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1605829458}
review:
Without a doubt, this game is fun. It's good, wholesome, 360-degrees-of-freedom fun. Descent holds a special place in my heart, being the game I grew up watching my Dad play, and eventually playing it all myself. 

This game is a worthy successor. The developers from the original Descent games banded together to build an absolutely gorgeous masterpiece. Flying feels good, the weapons have punch and weight, the bots are interesting and challenging, the upgrading system is a great incentive to hunt for secrets, the music and sound design are a fantastic medly to my ears. Even multiplayer feels good, albeit some weapons feel a tad underpowered, but it's of no consequence.

If you've been itching for that true 6DoF game that hasn't been scratched by some other releases in the past few years, you need this game. It's $30 well spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988119555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3492, 'last_played': 1679757369}
review:
Other reviewers have already said it; it's [i]practically[/i] Descent 4 in everything but name.

If you played Descent back in the day and enjoyed that series of games; you'll love this. [i]Overload[/i] offers some great gameplay imbued with modern twists to the destroy-the-reactor-and-escape formula, and also provides more than a few nods to earlier games in its lineage (musically, aesthetically and design wise; D1 through to D3).

Definitely worth a look if you love your 6DoF games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079978518', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1600107768}
review:
As many others have said, this is pretty much THE spiritual successor to the Descent series, getting the look and feel down closer any other. So closely, in fact, that muscle memory kicked in rather quickly and I found myself flying through the levels just like I used to. Only issue is that, instead of knowing every map, bot and weapon like the back of my own hand, I know nothing. The result has seen me repeatedly flying into large unknown spaces and groups of bots as if I had played the level many times, and then realising that I actually have no idea how to use my gun, what this missile does, or if that corner is safe to duck behind. The other thing I noticed was that I had to remap the keyboard to exactly how I had the Descent series set up because muscle memory kept trying to use that instead of WASD; which I thought was really cool because I could fly just fine with a typical WASD setup in every other 6dof game I've played in the last few years. A testiment to the solid controls here.

Technically, The game seems pretty solid as well. I've not had any performance issues, and it runs as I would expect it to run on my PC. No major glitches yet in the few hours I've been playing, though I did have one odd moment when the game appeared to freeze for maybe a second or so. Level design is claustrophobic and easy to get lost, turned around or just upside down in, as typical of the Descent games. It definately feels like you are flying through a fully automated mining camp.

Though I'm only 5 hours in, I'm loving this so much right now and can't wait to find out and discover the rest of the game.

-See you in the mines

author: {'steamid': '76561197971464480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1708548139}
review:
Made by the same developers of the older dos era descent games.
It feels and plays exactly like it, the levels are large and intricate, i only played past the first boss (6 levels or so ?) but it looks fantastic.
Coloured lighting, dynamic shadows, flares and great art design and awesome music from the same guys who made the music for the old games as well !

With 15 levels the game seems small, but i already played 5 hours for the first few levels and aparently they get much larger and more complex.

A level editor will be released (i think), so hopefully talented people will mod the descent 1 and 2 levels in it ;)

GO GET IT AND SUPPORT THEM !

author: {'steamid': '76561197972122561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1681924649}
review: Descent is back and it is a revival done right without flagshipping its fans. Finally a title with OOB support for a dual joystick setup without software hacks or tricks. Would buy Overload again :}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009530859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1413, 'last_played': 1535451432}
review: Stupendous flying and blasting and secret hunting. There is a FREE DEMO  not clearly advertised on the store page - search for Overload and you will see it. The default joypad controls are pretty much perfect, if you are new to this type of game you can easily get used to them in the training level. /// 5 difficulty levels ! Save anywhere ! A game for everyone ! I previously complained that cramped and similar areas made finding doors and switches too difficult, but I now concede that was because they are very cleverly hidden and I was not good at finding them. Only 8 save slots is annoying though with 15 levels and so many times you want to save so as to go back later and look for secrets/doors/switches/etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056487775', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 2844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2006, 'last_played': 1683840789}
review: this is a good game. i just beat it. i have an issue with the boost system where i've never had a real reason to ram anything, but other than that it feels like an actual descent game while having it's own original ideas with both robots and weapons

author: {'steamid': '76561197976934600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1529113853}
review:
The sights, the sounds, the music, the carnage.

This made me feel the same way I felt the very first time I played Descent 1, many, many years ago.  It's a good thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964215795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1576993284}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972097634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1529226430}
review:
If you remotely liked Descent games, GET THIS!  Loving the single player. They've totally nailed the feel of Descent, while the voice over narrative, video effects, audio and music all feel pretty slick and modern.  The music is duff duff - play it loud!

The Multiplayer could be great, but I'm barely finding games, and they only seem to be playing Anarchy mode (deathmatch).  I guess limited numbers of players during my NZ timezone.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989829963', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1584919494}
review:
This review is from my experience in SP.  Haven't played MP yet, but MP is just a bonus for me.  

We've waited forever for a new Descent game.  There have been some solid 6DOF games in the past 15+ years, but none of them get the feel right.  However, this isn't some cheap knock-off made by a different company.  This game is made by the guys who created it to begin with and understand how a Descent game should play and feel.  Everything about this is smooth.  It controls beautifully, and blowing up robots has the right amount of punch to make it satisfying.  The weapons are fun to shoot and varied enough to allow for different play styles.  The levels are well designed and interesting enough to make me want to explore to find all the powerups and secrets.  The story is interesting enough that I actually don't mind that they don't have the rights to the story and setting from Descent, and I actually like the audio clips that you collect in the levels a lot.  There is also a pretty fun horde mode which provides some single player replayability (though the campaign is worth playing again at harder difficulties and to find all the secrets). 

It's hard for me to complain about anything in this game as its pretty much exactly what I wanted - basically Descent 1+2 updated for the modern age.  It's simple, but it should be.  I've heard that the Multiplayer matchmaking system could use some work, so there is that.

If you like Descent buy this game and support these guys.  They did a great job and I think there is more to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993671143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1615598278}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970357880', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1674887891}
review: This is exactly the Descent successor I've been waiting all these years for.  It plays very much like Descent 2.  The gameplay is fluid and intuitive, the levels so far just the right amount of taxing.  The full 3 degrees of freedom takes a little getting use to but they keep using a lot of cues to remember which way is down.   My only real gripe thus far is the lack of multi-player coop and a level building tool, though I hear the latter may be in development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198416081253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1527988645}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014892412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3700, 'last_played': 1700760930}
review: So far so good with the multiplayer.  No lag at all, its really smooth and the gameplay is fantastic.   I do wish more people were online to support larger maps.  You are in action immediately which alot of people will like, but Id like a little more anticipation and finding weapons before you battle.   Fantastic gameplay though.  They did a great job on this all around.  Ill be ready for more consoles to get involved so there are more poeople online making team battles possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002508958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 17152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3461, 'last_played': 1543974407}
review: In more than 20 years of 6dof games, there have been 3 and two-halves good games in the genre -- Descent, Descent II, (part of) Descent 3, (part of) Sublevel Zero, and now Overload.  I've spent years playing Descent, both in PvE and PvP modes, and Overload recaptures almost every part of the original with some modern twists.  It's not completely going to replace the 1v1 ladder-match experience, but the single player, challenge mode, and anarchy modes are all top notch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062408820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1664564866}
review:
Just like Dusk, Amid Evil and Ion Maiden.......this game is just awesome! 

Nails everything what was great about the 90's and makes it even better.

Also congrats on the soundtrack, its so important a 90's style game has a quality one as modern games generally don't cut it in this area (except for the games I mentioned and Doom 2016).

I hope you get all the recognition and sales as I can tell you put a lot of love into this masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008967257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1546124173}
review: I haven't played Descent in over 20 years, but when I fired up Overload it felt like it might as well have been yesterday. One of the great spiritual sucessors in gaming and an extremely fun game on its own merits. 10/10 would blast robots again.

review: A beautiful trip back to the roots of FPS. You will get nostalgia with this one. It is like you are back to the 90s. This is truly Descent. Played this with a xbox 360 controller and the controls are tight. Might try it with the joystick too. Graphics are very nice, FX are very nice, music is perfect. The level design is out-of-this-world! It is very immersive and certainly a product of love from the developers to all of us, old and new gamers! You have to get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081974024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 23769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3440, 'last_played': 1692512670}
review: As a huge fan of the original Descent games, I feel that Overload does a great job of staying true to the original game.  Gameplay is fast, fun, and has the same "feel" as the originals.  As a bonus, they released a version for Linux too!  Very happy to support this game and highly recommend it.

review:
IF YOU LOVE DESCENT BUY THIS GAME IMMEDIATELY!

This is made by the original devs of Descent, and scored by the same musicians as Descent 1-3!

It plays amazingly! This game needs to be hyped way more because it's just that good and just that true to the Descent vision!

This isn't that bad Descent:Underground game that never got finished either! It's a full game with multiplayer, single player campaign and challenge missions! There's even a level editor coming! How cool is that?!?!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960691797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1707082048}
review:
The Descent guys are back and they are here to love you... with video games. This has to be one of my favorite games I've played in a long time. It definitely gives the Descent feel, perfectly, while still being new and fresh.

Singleplayer is fun and the maps can be large. The AI is fun to toy with, well, they toy with you; the AI is smart. There are a lot of secret areas to find and exploring is fun. Between levels you‚Äôre given the chance to upgrade your ship (based on upgrade points found in the map) which I really like.

Multiplayer seems put together well, and if cross-platform play comes into the picture, it will be even better! I haven‚Äôt played that much multiplayer though. As you play both singleplayer and multiplayer, you‚Äôll gain XP for multiplayer which lets you set your starting loadout (all weapons spawn in the maps though, nothing is hidden from you) and you can also tweak your ships playstyle to suit you. For example, you can have a little more armor or a little more damage as one of the many types of mini-tweaks you can do. This gives the game some variety while not being game breaking.

Buy this game and support these guys. If you do, you'll only get more games from them that are really well made.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995747727', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1595780166}
review:
The comments made by others that this is "Descent 4" cannot be overstated. This is a carefully crafted love-letter of a game to every fan of Descent there ever was or will be. It feels familiar while also incredibly refined. Gameplay and performance is silky smooth, loading is nearly instant on an HDD. I can't find one thing I dislike about it!

Highly recommended! 6DOF has never felt so good!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993703914', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1575631264}
review:
This game is to the Descent series what DOOM (2016) was to the Doom series. Fast paced, action oriented gameplay that hearkens back to its roots, making small changes to the formula. If you didn't play Descent or its sequels, it's a 6DOF (six degrees of freedom) shooter which means you can move in any direction, including yaw, roll, and pitch. Although you're technically in a space vessel of sorts, there's minimal inertia so it still plays much like a normal FPS otherwise. 

Its best features are pulled right from 90s game design, including its labyrinthine maps, chock full of secrets and pickups. Exploration is encouraged as the maps hide numerous powerups, many of which can be used between levels to improve your craft and arsenal. Weapons are satisfying to use, with most enemies dying to a few good hits and having a good sense of impact. As both you and your enemies all use projectile weaponry, it makes combat fast and frenetic as you try to lead your target with your weapons whilst simultaneously dodging those of your opponent. 

The campaign is great and ramps up the difficulty well, with several difficulty levels available from the start, with a hidden hard difficulty and harder new game plus mode. It also includes a challenge mode where you compete on leaderboards in a wave based arena mode, and multiplayer modes. At the time of writing only free for all deathmatch has any regular activity however. 

Overall I love this game. It's a modern take on Descent that retains everything that made the original great, adding on just enough elements such as the upgrade mechanics, and the story told through voice logs to elevate it above simple pastiche.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022058357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4423, 'last_played': 1654560138}
review:
I got this game through the kickstarter campaign.  I have been a big fan of Descent for many years.  This is awesome!  Is it exactly like Descent?  No.  Is that bad? Absolutely not.  

The controls are very customizable, so anybody can find something that works well for them.  The ship flight mechanic is great.  It just seems to flow.

I haven't finished the single player campaign yet, but so far the level design is fantastic.  It is haunting and claustrophobic.  The music and robot sound effects just add to that.  Trying to find your way through a pitch black cavern and hearing the quite noise one of the melee bots makes can be a little creepy.  The story is intriguing so far.  I want to see where it goes.

There are different modes to choose from.  There are two types of challenge mode.  One sets a timer, with the goal to kill as many "auto ops" as you can.  The other is infinite.  Both are great and have leader boards so you can see how well you do compared to others.

I haven't had much time to put into multiplayer.  I'll update this after I do.

Overall I am loving the game.  It is great fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970508018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1530424326}

Edit: The amount of options in this game is crazy. Its like 1995 all over again. The Devs really put a lot of work into the settings menu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039818619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 924, 'last_played': 1608005842}
review:
Absolutely brilliant, recaptures the old Descent nostalgia perfectly and re-packages it for modern tastes. The level design is old-school Descent--minus the claustrophobic tight corridors--and there's not a lot in the way of the more-realistic detail work we're used to seeing in games these days, but I find that I don't really notice the lack. Overload does a really good job striking a balance between the minimalist aesthetics of the old Descent games and the more slick visual fanfare of contemporary titles.

The soundtrack is audiophile heaven. It makes liberal use of the industrial sounds of the Descent 2 soundtrack but is much more symphonic and melodic. Whereas Descent 2's soundtrack was brash and "in your face", Overload's doesn't scream for your attention and just lets you play the game but still has enough cool riffs and beats to stand out. With several different artists in the mix it can sometimes be a mixed bag when styles diverge, but it's still all good. If you're into soundtracks, do yourself a favor and get the package with the soundtrack.

In short, Overload is a must-have for fans of the old series and a great entry to the 6 DOF shooter genre for new fans, and the explosions are pretty enough to keep even the most shameless eye-candy junkie sated. Better yet, it supports VR out of the box and playing with a headset is an absolute blast. Mileage may vary...if you tend to motion sickness you're going to have a bit of a rough go of it. But if you've got the stomach and the chops, VR is the ONLY way to play Overload.

Ok, now stop reading reviews and just buy the game already!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003942715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1532405586}
review:
TL;DR
buy it, even at full price. it's great
-----
Coming into this game having only played Freespace 2, which came after the Descent games, I quickly learned I had no idea what I was doing. And I loved it. This game is fast paced and it definitely took me an hour or so to get the hang of it, but so far I'm really enjoying it. The campaign levels have taken me on average 15 minutes to complete (on the 3rd hardest difficulty), but that doesn't include dying! Also, I nowhere near finished any with 100% completion, so I'll be replaying a lot after I finish the game. 

I play on an xbox 360 controller because a flightstick would probably confuse me too much with how fast you need to fly. I really like the 360 controls and will most likely stick with it, but i've heard some people are experimenting with Steam Controllers which I might try (gyroscope).

Multiplayer is really fun and you have to approach it differently than singleplayer. As of writing, I bought the game one day after its release so there aren't many players on yet but the longest I've waited for a game is around 90 seconds, not too bad considering how few are playing right now. 

Supposedly, there are many cool sounding updates planned that should add even more.
I bought this on a whim and definitely don't regret it at full price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033339805', 'num_games_owned': 2113, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1590207165}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970506995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1647975779}
review:
Back in the day when Parallax Software released Descent,  I played the HECK out of it as this was among the very first '6 Degrees of Freedom' games to come to market .  I upgraded my 486/33Mhz CPU to a 486/66Mhz just for this game,  and then a week later built my first Pentium 1  133Mhz system;  again, just for Descent.  I then bought a Virge DX 3D video card (which was more like a 3D Deccelerator...).  Descent cost me a lot of money and time,  but it was worth every penny.  I bought Descent 2, Descent 3, and every mission pack that was released for all the games.    I even managed to break the high-hat off my Thrustmaster Joystick several times playing Descent, where Thrustmaster tech support's first comment was,  "Been playing too much Descent, huh?".  They sent a mailer with three new high-hat switches and I installed them myself (on multiple occasions).

So here we are today with a very worth successor to the original Descent series.  This game has beautiful graphics,  familiar-yet-fresh/modern gameplay, and a few new tricks along the way.  The game is story driven without being pedantic,  so you have a good sense of mission throughout the game's levels. I like the little audio logs you find along the way that help unfold the story about how the mining robots ran amok.   They also added a new 'upgrade' mechanic where you find multiple upgrade spheres during a level which can them be used to improve ship features and armament.   You're rewarded for being thorough when searching through the levels with more upgrade sphere and more audio logs that really fill in story details.  

I also LOVE that the devs of this game really spent some time showing love to all kinds of control schemes,  so that a Joystick is not required to play.  I'm playing through the entire game with my mouse /keyboard and it feels natural and fluid.  

10/10 would buy again. 

P.S. I play Overload on Linux (Fedora 28) and it runs flawlessly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135093487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1650128378}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962252880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1666921598}
review: Finally, a genuine old school shooter. Rather than lifting a slapdash assortment of gameplay components without understanding why they worked (a la Doom 2016), Overload understands exactly what made its source material so compelling: purity. At the core of it is movement, and movement in Overload feels extremely right - your ship is nimble and responsive, and the auto-leveling is smooth, smart, and adjustable. Weapon design is well-considered if slightly perfunctory, with each weapon filling a particular niche and providing plenty of zappy/explodey feedback. With regard to the single player campaign, enemy design is tight and smart, with placement and enemy types cleverly ramping up the difficulty the deeper you get. And the level design is phenomenal, with an impressive judiciousness when it comes to space - its areas rarely feel claustrophobic or cavernous, but the influence of the environment during firefights is keenly felt. Exploration is heavily rewarded, with part of your finds relegated to an XP/point system that allows you to selectively upgrade your ship and its weapon systems. Though visually it's a bit short on spectacle, everything on display is extremely clean and well-textured, with excellent lighting and bloom that really makes the otherwise spartan sci-fi industrial environments really pop. Overload does not reach far beyond the confines of the Descent games it's succeeding, but within that framework, it accomplishes everything it sets out to do with confidence and style, and given the drought of proper shooters on the market (especially among remakes), that's a special thing indeed. Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006440230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1695483699}
review: habe das game noch nicht abgeschlossen, aber was ich bis jetzt schon sagen kann: bis auf die story, die aber vernachl√§ssigbar ist, ist descent 4, √§h overload, genau das, was ich mir schon seit descent 3 als nachfolger erhofft und gew√ºnscht habe.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961218000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1662059128}
review: Absolutely worth the price. Gameplay is smooth as butter and lotsa fun. You need to think in 3 dimensions which can be a bit tricky at first but all good games will challenge you. The extra time the devs took to make this right shows. Kudos to them. I hope they do well financially with Overload. They deserve it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042306914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2144, 'last_played': 1698265009}
review: You're given a wide range of cleverly designed, powerful weaponry, and your missions is to go explore, destroy those almost human-like enemies and fight your way through the mines. If that doesn't sound exciting to you, well you haven't tried it. A must have for people who want their games challenging, fast paced and open.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970413825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1549661513}
review:
I'd love to write a more detailled review, but I NEED to play more Overload right now.
Seriously... In case you liked previous Descent games, stop reading and start buying. This turned out to be exactly what I hoped for when I heard about it.

Great work, Revival Productions. Thanks for "reviving" part of my childhood memories!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1633116658}
review:
Juuuchuu..einfach Fantastische arbeit ..hatte fast Tr√§nen in den Augen.Man merkt dem neuem Descent(Overload) an das mit Herzblut an der Fortsetzung gearbeitet wurde.Es ist den Entwicklern gelungen das alte zu bewaren und weiter zu verbessern einfach nur Cool die alte Schule.Ich w√ºnsche Revial Produktions alles Gute und viel Erfolg mit dem Spiel.

Ps: Ich spiele mit Oculus Rift + 1080ti und habe keine Motion Sicknees bekommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000850149', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1530454640}
review:
Plays really well in VR, also really great on flat screen. I used to play Descent and this game feels way better than any recent clone of the original descent.
First levels are plenty big, full of secrets that make you want to check every conners. Can't wait to finish this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143344663', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1689035339}
review: This is Descent through and through, sucks they couldn't call it that. Rest in peace Interplay, long live Overload!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051097488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3570, 'last_played': 1639878944}
review: The EA version was amazing, can't wait to get the rest of the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008591444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1529130192}
review:
This game is absolutely amazing, Descent reincarnate.
If you like descent you will love it.
Some other games may fall into this description, but THIS IS DESCENT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198127287925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1585368808}
review:
The level design is sprawling, the enemies aggressive, handling has that nice sense of inertia from Descent and the weapons all feel good and unique.

If you're even remotely a fan of Descent, grab this game now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986924893', 'num_games_owned': 2539, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 46149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1697675966}
review:
The game is solid and fun to play. Multiplayer is really fun though the lobby system is kinda meh and random. I fear that the Online players will drop very quickly like most games that arent fortnightcodpubgwhatever, that is a shame because it's another game where the devs added mp specific achievements that will be impossible to get when that happens, but for right now it's amazing! The music is incredible. It controls very well on mouse and keyboard, gamepad can be kind of a chore to find easy to get to buttons for all the maneuvering that makes this game fun. I may try to play this with the gyro on the DS4 and Steam Controller that might be the golden ticket.  Joystick is pretty good but dual joysticks can be kinda tricky for the same reason that the controller can and because there isn't a throttle.

I am 100% pleased with my return from backing this project on kickstarter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017871223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1699125886}
review: Best Descent ever. All E.A. promisses kept. Thank you Revival Team for this great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972773539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1648908151}
review:
Wie spitze ist das denn? Descent, okay jetzt Overload, so wie man es von fr√ºher her kennt. Nur eben neu und mit neuer Grafik. Die Steuerung ist aber gleich, hab mich sofort zurecht gefunden.

Wer Descent von damals noch kennt und es damals schon gut fand, der wird mit Overload spa√ü haben. Man muss aber gestehen, dass das nicht jedermanns Sache ist. Dem einem wird schlecht, der n√§chste kommt einfach nicht mit der Steuerung klar....

Das Einzige, was ich √ºberhaupt nicht mag, das ist die Musik. Gut, das ist Geschmackssache. Aber dieses Techno-Gedudel. Mann, das ist echt nicht meins. Aber man kann die Musik ja ausschalten :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197978373768', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1572131278}
review: THIS is the follow up to Descent that we've been waiting for! Descent broke the mold and changed the industry when it released back in 1995, and those of us who played it back then have never forgotten the amazing gameplay and immersive, claustrophobic environments. In the intervening years a few others have tried their hands at the 6DOF genre, but no one gets it as well as the people that created it. The original devs from Descent 1, 2, and 3 have come back together to form Revival Productions and have demonstrated again why we need them to create the true successor to the Descent series. There's something about the way that they blend the feeling of the movement, the weapons, the enemy design and AI, the level design and art, and the sound and music to produce something that just can't be matched by their imitators. If you've ever wondered why a euphoric grin spreads the faces of those who grew up with Descent whenever it is mentioned and why we can't shut up about it, PLAY THIS GAME!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031995857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1498174884}
review: Excellent game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972881473', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1015, 'last_played': 1700574117}
review: Very, very well executed game.  The multiplayer is FANTASTIC.  I was a huge fan of Descent, and this feels like Descent 2018.  The graphics are gorgeous, the game runs silky smooth, the multiplayer is fun, accurate, no lag.  Thank you so much for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970463052', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1529711099}
review:
This game is a lot of fun! I played a lot of all 3 of the original Descent games, and this feels the closest to those games than any other 6DOF game I've played.  I think the weapons could still use some balancing and the matching system could benefit from some modern features (like forming a party, game types and filtering, etc).  I'd also love to see some profile/match stats! I'm also looking forward to the level editor; the existing multiplayer maps feel super cramped.

Overall, I love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998011202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 88307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1707714119}
review:
These are the droids you're looking for.

Played through half of the story so far, as well as a few dozen multi-player matches. I've held Descent 1 as my favorite game of all time since I was a kid. But I think Overload is going to boot it from that number 1 spot. Everything about the game play is improved, engaging, and all-around fantastic. A visceral experience in both SP and MP! 

I mostly play on a stick, but mouse also feels really good here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970247614', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1146, 'last_played': 1652879695}
review:
Descent is back, better than ever. Need to say more?

How to truly appreciate the Descent lineage:
Play Descent 1 + 2 (Rebirth) > Overload

PROS:
Ship/weapon customizations
Stellar graphics 
Fluid control
Authentic Descent experience

CONS:
No co-op multiplayer... but the original did.

Personal CONS:
- Player ship design is unaesthetic in comparison with the original Pyro-GX design. It looks like a space tractor or a cargo loader. But it's not like it's in your face all the time.
- Enemy designs are also a bit underwhelming and not as menacing/creative as their original counterparts (inspirations). You just cannot forget the terror when a Lifter or Diamond Claw lunges at you with that horrible shriek and scratching sound.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960295870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1528268402}
review: As everyone else has said, this is Descent 4. It's clearly a love letter to the old games, made by the same people, and with the same game systems. It's awesome. Just go buy it. It's an oldschool videogame and it deserves love and support.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971417681', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1608500888}
review:
This is an early review as I've only got  2 hours in it so far, but here are my thoughts anyway.

I've only played in VR and that's the only way I intend to play. 

The store page says amazing graphics, I wouldn't call them amazing, they get the job done and are passable, but not amazing, but then VR games rely more on Immersion and fun, even so I think some things could do with looking a bit better.

Controls, first I tried a PS4 controller, ugh ugh ugh, terrible, I mean it works but trying to tilt the nose up and down with any kind of accuracy sucked.  Swithed to Keyboard + Mouse, heaven.  Precise control, made it more enjoyable.  Using a Keyboard + mouse in VR was fine as there's not many keys to use.

Not sure if this was my end or some other issue, but now and again the screen in my Rift went black for a few seconds,  so will see if it's the game or something else.

Before purchasing I was a little concerend about VR motion sickness, I mean you're twisting, turning, spinnng etc in the game and whilst I don't suffer from VR sickness it was a concern, happy to say I didn't get any.

The gameplay is basically the same as Descent, it obviously won't have the same impact as it did back in the day but playing it in VR is fun and brings back some good memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970782811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1662249542}
review: Forget the rest - this is the 6DOF game you're looking for. With the original Descent team on board, this is the new standard for what 6DOF games should be. The feel is perfect (with plenty of customisation options to ensure it controls exactly the way you want it to), the visuals may but straightforward but the lighting effects are spectacular, the weapons are awesome, the level design is filled with twists and turns in all the best ways, and there's a ton of content in here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085808714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1754, 'last_played': 1690716600}
review: Worthy successor to Descent series. Handles like a dream. Just Buy It!!!! 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197988903500', 'num_games_owned': 2136, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1679700306}
review: A Descent game hasn't been made or worked on by these guys since 1999 but playing this you wouldn't know it, feels like they never missed a beat and I'm hard pressed to find anything that it lacks as a spiritual successor to Descent. If anything it might actually be quite a bit better than Descent in a lot of ways. I'm actually kind of shocked, I mean we live in world where usually when an old series gets revived especially if its a spiritual successor it takes liberty's with the design or tries to kind of copy the design but loses something in process, here we literally got everything we wanted and more. It really blows the other 6-DoF shooters that have come out lately right out of the fucking water.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008426364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1527837564}
review:
When this game came out, I could of sworn it had no multiplayer.  Now it does.  I am using a vive pro for my small impression.  Using a high end system, this game looks superb.  Audio and music is right on.  Using a xbox one controller  with the default settings feels tight and smooth.  Anybody who has ever played descent style game will certainly like this one.  I have more than .4 hours using a none steam Version.

for VR, it is superb.  I have not noticed any nausea from playing this.  The video shown certainly would give you that impression but if you have grown your VR legs, this is a really good title to have for your collection using an twinstick controller such as an xbox one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071594947', 'num_games_owned': 1394, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1414, 'last_played': 1710426954}

review: This game is wonderful.  It has fluid movement (the 6DOF feels very natural), its gunplay feels great, and it just looks so damn beautiful.  It has both single player and multi player and both feel fleshed out and it honestly is so good that I am going to go back and try out the original Descent games that spawned it.  Absolutely worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997425579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1591, 'last_played': 1671922223}
review:
If you've read virtually any review on Steam, you should know that Overload is the true spiritual successor to Descent. If that franchise name (or Forsaken, for that matter) means anything at all to you, you can stop reading and buy it now (if you already haven't). But, if it doesn't, there are plenty of reasons to buy Overload.

Essentially, Overload is a modernized Six-Degrees-Of-Freedom corridor shooter - in layman's terms, a zero-gravity FPS. Think the ending of "The Return of the Jedi" meets "DOOM" and you have a pretty good idea of what to expect here - not just in terms of control, but of gameplay. At it's core, Overload is as old-school an FPS as they come. Explore huge, labyrinthine levels, collect keys, find the nuclear reactor, blow it up, and fly through the escape hatch before the countdown ends. Collect a wide variety of weapons, pick up ammo and health, and shoot anything that moves.

But all that describes Descent too, and that's a game that's a whopping 23 years old now - and despite being totally playable even today, it's a product of its time. Where Overload shines is in how it updates the gameplay so effectively for a modern audience. As the humble joystick has fallen out of favor with most gamers - especially FPS fans - the controls have been optimized for both mouse & keyboard and gamepad players (although joystick is still a supported and viable option). RPG-Lite elements such as weapon and ship upgrades encourage exploration and critical thinking. A relatively in-depth story with surprisingly strong voice work helps lend a sense of purpose to the action. A fully-functional challenge (arcade) mode with online leaderboards will appeal to those with a really competitive side, and a modest but well-balanced and highly-competitive multiplayer suite rounds out the package. There's a lot of content for the modest asking price - more than most AAA titles, actually.

With a revived interest among gamers in reviving old-fashioned FPS games (See: Doom '16 [which the Overload dev team credits as being a large inspiration], Dusk, Ion Maiden, etc.), Overload shouldn't appeal to only a small niche of gamers that remember Descent or Forsaken from their youth. No, this is just a fun shooter, plain and simple. You like fun shooters? Buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007399877', 'num_games_owned': 1411, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1625975354}
review:
I backed this game and hadn't played it since one of the earliest alphas; Well I just got done playing the first level all the way through the first boss and oooh boy Descent 4 is here and thy name is Overload. 

The movement, the robots, the weapons, the levels, the lighting, the feel, the challenge, the mood, the music... all nail at least in my head what Descent 2 would be like in 2018

and as a bonus the game runs like hot butter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993213000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1527706949}
review:
After more than 20 years, the original six-degrees-of-freedom shooter franchise is reborn as Overload! If you already loved Descent as a kid, this is exactly what you'd expect. For anyone who doesn't have a clue what Descent or a "six-degrees-of-freedom shooter" is, check out the video below!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yO6hsrR8Sr0

author: {'steamid': '76561197973522980', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1559562709}
review:
The mission briefings are the same, the difficulty levels are the same, the ship you start out in is a compact version of the Pyro, the guidebot is there, the locked doors make the same sound when you hit them.  This game is Descent in everything but name.  This game is everything I remember from Descent II 22 years ago.  Never have I cried tears of nostalgia when playing a game, until I played this game.

Shame on Interplay for hoarding the Descent brand and giving the next game of the series to a different development team.

Update: 
After playing the game a bit more, I do have one complaint, and that's the level variety is lacking.  Each level looks the same.  Still recommend the game, though.  Controls best with mouse and keyboard, in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123442009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1575858735}
review:
Los controles son muy eficientes, los graficos VFx muy buenos y llamativos. 

Me gusto:
Los efectos, las explosiones y los visuales muy asombrosos y llamativos. 
La musica emocionante y los efectos de sonido. Bastante bien en general.
Esta mejor optimizado que en el acceso anticipado y puedo jugar en Ultra exepto las reflecciones espaciales en una 1050 TI a 1080p.
Los mapas buenisimos, llenos de secretos, armas logs e historia, no se siente claustrofobicos xD, y es un buen paso para llevarlos a zonas con exteriores en alguna futura entrega. (Almenos no he visto exteriores y es que voy a la mitad xD)
Los enemigos en los primeros niveles faciles obvio para que aprendas a esquivarlos, pero despues comienza el verdadero sudor en esquivar sus ataques y contratacar al mismo tiempo. (He tenido que guardar un par de veces xD y volver a cargar xD )

SOlo echo en falta cinematicas y algunas armas como en Descent 3. Pero siguiendo la pauta de Descent 1 y 2 esta exelente y mas con multi y VR.

Le falta:

Realmente nada xD solo echarle mas horas al multi xD (Es un buen inicio de una saga, y merece mas atencion. La primera saga la jugue a los 9 a√±os y he esperado casi 15 a√±os xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198020783949', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8, 'playtime_at_review': 3516, 'last_played': 1711344655}
review: This game is quickly becoming one of my all time favorites! The singleplayer is great and maintains everything I enjoyed about the original Descent games while improving nearly everything. The sound design and music seem especially excellent. The only minor inconvenience on that front is the lack of a master volume slider in the options. Overall I simply can't recommend this game enough. It's so GOOD!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019730955', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 2166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1877, 'last_played': 1551925689}
review:
If you know what Descent or 6dof is, this is exactly that, made by by the original creators of Descent 1&2. This is the Quake/DooM of space-sim games. Forget about Descent Underground, this is the real deal right here!

You're still clearing mines of virused mining robots. You're still collecting keycards. You're still saving hostages. You're still blowing up reactors and rushing to the exit. There are still secrets behind rectangular hidden doors. Even the music was made by the guys who made the music for Descent 1,2 and 3 (and it's pretty LIT!). If you thought DooM/Quake had big, complex maps, prepare to be [i]absolutely overwhelmed[/i] (you can use a guide bot if you want).

Hell, even the mapping tools of Unity were adjusted by the devs to make it more like the original Descent (which used a cube brush for everything). This gives the levels that nostalgic feeling, but comes at the cost of map fidelity - and it's rather noticeable. A lot of textures are rather same-y (especially inside unstructured caves), as a result of which the planets/moons you're visiting don't really get their unique theme the same way they do in old Descent games, where each mine had it's own theme and feeling depending on the geology there. This makes orientation hard as well, because a lot of places look way too similar.

The devs tried to do the same thing DooM 2016 did to arcadey shooters, especially in the upgrade system part, but it really does come off as if they were... too afraid to do anything crazy. That's really the only criticism I have for this game - it does Descent very well, but it doesn't really try to evolve in any way.

The only way this game could be more Descent is if you replaced your ship model with a Pyro-GX. Modders, you know what to do! ;)

review: This. This is a Descent successor done right. It is the first time I've witnessed 6DOF perfection since Descent 2. THANK YOU Revival for all your hard work on Overload. I still have Descent 1 music in my head when playing this game though, haha.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996502465', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1695121318}
review: A great game by honest people who know what they're doing, veterans of video game industry, people who in times of lootboxes, greed, maiming the audience and kickstarter scams deliver more than what was promised. Great level design with gameplay and story incentives to keep exploring, secrets, tight controls, thought out weapons and upgrades, intelligent, varied enemies. Graphics are simple and elegant, maybe not the most realistic in the world but sharp and of high quality. All of this topped off with good techno soundtrack and decent story. Not enough? How about a multiplayer component? Or a challenge mode? VR? You got it! One flaw i can think of is the optimization. I realize that I don't have the fastest rig in the world but 1050 should be able to handle this game better. Does it deserve your money? If you're 6dof fan- just buy it!! If you're not, still, absolutely. Game is friendly to beginners to the gerne and offers a lot of help- an automap or a holographic guide to literally hold your hand so don't be too woried. Whomever you are, please, try this game. It's a title from times long gone by (with all the right modern additions:) )-  when gameplay was king and devs respected your money

author: {'steamid': '76561197966562259', 'num_games_owned': 842, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1538255981}
review:
If I woke up from an 18 year coma and you sat me down in front of this game without showing me the title and asked me what game it was, I would unequivocally respond with "Descent 4"

So take that as you will. If you loved the old Descent games, you will feel 100% at home here. The environments even feel the same, right down to their blocky, rectangular architecture. Unfortunately it also gives them something of a weird out-of-time feeling, since it almost feels like an HD texture and lighting pack on top of the original geometry. Environments lack detail or clutter, and generally still feel like tubes and corridors, rather than a cohesive base with purpose or layout.

But at the end of the day, that stuff doesn't really matter. This isn't Deus Ex. You aren't exploring the environment for clues or opening cabinets to find hidden goodies. This is DESCENT. Fly around in zero G and blast the s**t out of anything that moves. Run into suspiciously placed walls looking for a ton of secrets (the first level has 15). Blow up the reactor and scramble to the exit before you're caught in the explosion.

So yeah, if you loved Descent, you will love this game. If you wanted some kind of reboot that controls like Descent but looks like Doom 2017, you might be disappointed.

Personally, I got everything that I paid for (as a backer of the Kickstarter). I signed up for a new Descent, and that's what I got.

8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172615435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1530306876}

author: {'steamid': '76561198096412999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1708904144}
review:
2 Minute Video Review ‚Üí https://youtu.be/DVJlKmHT91A

Overload is made by the original creators of Descent. It‚Äôs almost identical to the original but created from the ground up for modern systems, including VR support.

I usually prefer VR games that allow you to stand and use motion controllers. But for this I was happy to make an exception since I‚Äôve enjoyed playing the original Descent games ever since the late 90‚Äôs.

This brought back a ton of nostalgia for me. Many elements of this mirror the originals. Like the obvious 6 degrees of freedom, the way the enemy bots behave, and how the levels end by blowing up the reactor and escaping before the end of the self destruct sequence. All of the things that made the original great are here again, and cranked up to 11.

There‚Äôs just one thing missing that I wish for: CO-OP campaigns. There‚Äôs currently deathmatch multiplayer, which is fun. But being able to play through the campaigns in CO-OP with other players would be especially great.

This game doesn‚Äôt require VR. But for me, it‚Äôs the only way to play.
If you love the original Descent games, then I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969378273', 'num_games_owned': 4890, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1704864171}

review: I can honestly say this game is a true to life resurrection of the classic Descent game series.  Fluid gameplay, usable controls, excellent graphics and audio.  Well worth the buy, I look forward to streaming the hell out of this for a while.  Well done Revival, well done.
