author: {'steamid': '76561197998169371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1676161381}
review:
If you loved the original Descent games (who didn't?) you're gonna love this. 

The look and feel, and the gameplay are very similar but also fresh, which is just right because fans of the original series want to relive those happy memories of countless hours spent thundering along dark tunnels in pursuit of keys, and powerups, robot mashing mayhem and where the heck is that secret entrance. 

But it feels fresh too, not just because the graphics are advanced by several generations, but because there are new robots and weapons and other stuff, but as always they're out to toast your butt, so block out your diary, suit up, lock and load and blow that reactor.

There's more than enough here to justify the cost at this point, and the fact that many of the original Descent dev team are in on this remake means it's not just another project but one which they are gonna pull out all the stops for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052768227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1098, 'last_played': 1710719916}
review:
A smooth, streamlined 6DoF shooter with a history long predating its development.

From the people who made Descent so many years ago, a modernization of the same mechanics (without the same title, for legal reasons). Even the weapons are mostly the same concept. That's not to say that the game isn't original or inventive; there are plenty of things unique to it as well (time bombs, creepers, the overload powerup). The game simply draws from an older inspiration, and is therefore better thought-out, and has even picked up some of the old community surrounding Descent.

The ship is a joy to control, and all the weapons and so on are intuitive and responsive. The game has an easy setting on which you can demolish hundreds of enemies, but it can also get very challenging if you set it that way. The atmosphere can vary from map to map, but it tends to be a little dark and somber. Not a horror game, but dark nonetheless. A lot like its predecessor, Descent.

As it currently stands, the game has three story-mode (read: campaign, there is no real story) levels, and an infinite survival sort of "challenge mode" with eight or nine maps. The challenge mode can get a little repetitive in my opinion, but it takes a while. Updates have been regular and never fail to introduce something new and interesting. The game also has the ability to give you a good deal of statistical information on your own performance (if that interests you).

author: {'steamid': '76561197971884386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1529116835}
review: This is what I've been waiting for.  Actual Descent.  Even though it lacks the name, everything else is there.  The art direction  and implementation is phenomenal, it looks exactly how descent would look if it were made today (which it is, it's Overload).  The sound and music are fantastic, the enemies are super fun to duke it out with, the visuals are shiny in exactly the right way, and the movement is spot on.  Game is limited at the moment but if the campaign follows the trend set by the outpost demo level this will be one hell of a revival for 6DoF games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960780797', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1503318858}
review:
It is Descent, in VR.  It is a really good fit, but initially it made me want to vomit.  6DOF control and locomotion style control is crazy hard on your brain, but once you realize there is no floor it gets better.  Great, infact.  

The six degrees of freedom in this game combine with using an HMD make for some really sick gameplay.  Circle strafing and shooting in 3D while scoping out your next target coming in from your top right is spectacular.  The levels are quite complicated to navigate but there is a 3D map and also a guide you can follow, if you want to do that.  When I had the default graphics settings the game ran pretty poorly in VR but once i turned off ambient occlusion it ran much higher, 90fps.  

If you were a fan of the originals, you'll probably enjoy this. Early access, and says it will be releasing early 2018.  Pretty cool right now, but will be even better later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042663488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 255, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1711909460}
review:
Rarely do I bother with a review..

TLDR; If you enjoyed the original, you will likely love this one. I do.

Some context -  I'm an old gamer. I'm an Elite Dangerous early backer (to recapture Elite from back in the BBC micro days). I also backed "Descent Underground" for the same reasons - nostalgia - for the days when low-ping-bast*rds and modems were a thing.

A while ago I re-bought all of the original Descent (1/2/3)  series (ty GoG) hoping to enjoy the replays. - Sadly, in my eyes, those games are just too dated on modern hardware.

This version, by the original Descent crew, has entirely captured the original feel, and If I'm being honest, more so than the similarly named 'Descent Underground".

I'm looking forward to the full version and wondering what mutli-player is going to feel like.

Come on guys, you kinda/sorta have the mass-driver, now bring on the MegaMissile. quad lasers, fusion cannon and lets not forget the vauss.. I need the vauss cannon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102744735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 26891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 62, 'playtime_at_review': 24633, 'last_played': 1711932151}
review:
Not as good as Descent.

Has a nice challenge mode where you fight to the death vs CPU droids in various arenas. Probably the best game mode IMO.

Some of the robots are not very well balanced and to be honest the single player and challenge mode is drastically impaired as a result. For example, some enemies fire at you IMMEDIATELY when you turn a corner, giving you no chance at all to react. I honestly HATED wandering around the mines in this game for this one single design choice. It totally wrecks my enjoyment of the game. I don't mind fighting tough enemies, but watching 1/3 of my non-regenerating shield disappear because there is ONE enemy shooting me point blank the moment I turn a corner is something that I just can't forgive this game for. I mean, I can take out a room with like 20 or 30 droids without taking a single hit... only to have 1/3 of my shield taken out by ONE droid like that? For God's sake, at least give the robot a small pause before it starts to shoot. Even on a multiplayer game, theres always a small reaction time when players turn a corner and bump into each other. But no, these droids shoot INSTANTLY. Tell you what, how about you just remove the droid and delete my shield with a few lines of code instead huh? It will still suck but at least it would be an improvement on the situation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021445467', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1608958489}
review:
Pros: It's quite fun to play, and very reminiscent of Descent. :-)
Cons: I couldn't get it to work with either by wireless xbox 360 controller or my HOTAS. It didn't seem to register commands from the xbox controller at all (I did have my joystick plugged in at the same time but the xbox controller was selected), and it didn't seem to register the throttle on the throttle of my HOTAS at all (just the throttle on joystick 1... no good for a HOTAS setup where I want to use a controller in each hand). Hopefully, controls will be improved as the game develops further.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976858806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1581900207}
review:
Overload is the definitive Descent 6DOF spiritual successor. Do you like flying down corridors that branch off into a maze of dangerous tunnels and secret passages all the while blasting mean looking and sometime scary robots? This is the game for you. Do you like finding a security key that is easy to pick up, too easy....only to find yourself surronded by baddies which makes you punch the afterburner to escape? Do you enjoy the feeling of finally finding the reactor core and firing your biggest guns at it, making it overload, while you run towards the exit hoping you don't get incinerated? Yeah, get this game if you like any of those things. Chocked full of carnage and desperate "Where's the next armor power-up???" moments, powerful weapons, powerful game engine that is only getting better...VR support....jesus, what else do you need? Dev team is great and communicates often with updates and details.

TL:DR - Action packed 6 Degrees-of-Freedom maze crawling/running - robot blasting madness that doesn't get boring. Get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983491508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1581281576}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998738129', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1653928827}
review: I was one of the hard-core players of Descent and Descent II back in the days of my 486. I remember installing the free multiplayer demo on my high school network drive and completely derailing entire class periods in our "Computers" class. Absolutely beautifully re-created. You can tell that the devs love the game, and want to hold to its original spirit while adding balanced improvements. Levels, weapons, soundtrack, and even settings thus far are all a joy. I love that more difficult game modes do not just dial up the enemy armor 500% and triple wave density. Soo excited for the final release, but thrilled that the devs are making meaningful ~monthly releases. I honestly haven't knowingly experienced a single bug, outside of one black screen launch, which was easily recovered from with the super-thoughtful launch option for recovery. If anyone is on the fence about re-living their gaming adolescence in HD, just do it, and I'll see you in there once multiplayer opens up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970960789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1710627152}
review:
What can I say apart from this is the game I have been waiting for!
Not many games in the 90s held my attention quite as much as Descent! The tension, the claustrophobia, the intense atmosphere combined with frightening AI and crazy level design.

Somehow Overload is capturing it all, even my muscle memory instantly returned with this game!
Would 100% recommend! This game has come so far in such little time, really looking forward to the finished product. Keep up the good work! 

Word of warning: Sadly I fell into the trap of purchasing Descent Underground under the impression it was the real deal only to find out I got a bit excited and impulse purchased before doing my research! Yeah my bad XD
1 : It plays like a generic 6DOF game, just not Descent 
2 : Its created by a team that licenced the name and even had the cheek to include original Descent footage in there launch trailer to trick buyers as if they contributed! (This has since been removed but still, it‚Äôs a dirty tactic that‚Äôs obviously caused them some shade) 

So my conclusion, this is the spiritual successor to Descent in every sense of the word!
If you are an old school fan get a copy now! 

If you purchased Underground aswell, my commiserations (it could still turn out ok if the devs stop farting around with multiplayer & you ignore the name and just treat it like a generic 6DOF game‚Äù

author: {'steamid': '76561197997521492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 17412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17071, 'last_played': 1534349015}
review:
After having racked up almost 130 hrs of Overload game time since around mid-April, I thought I'd take the plunge and provide a few lines and share the love for this title. I'm not, and never was, a "Triple-D" (Devout-Descent-Disciple) - I admired the concept, but simply didn't fall in love with 6DOF back in the 90's. 

There are enough reviews from "Triple-D's" here on Steam as well as the Overload forums, that virtually everything positive about Overload has already been said - so what can I add as an apparent "pagan"?

For those gamers that perhaps have either never indulged in a 6DOF affair, or have dipped their toes in, but found the temprature somewhat uncomfortable, Overload is a breath of fresh air - because it works flawlessly and is absolutely accessible in a very minimalistic way ! When it comes to gaming that involves wreaking explosive havoc on any form of enemy by means of an impressive incendiary arsenal, there are some critical factors that must be in place to hook me and keep me coming back for more: minimal time spent in config/setup menus, pitch-perfect and responsive controls, ambience and immersion (art-style, sound, lighting), simple and compelling gameplay. I was having fun with Overload within 10 minutes in much the same way that ID games captivated me back in the 90's - all of the ingredients were there!

Challenge mode alone is currently worth the price of admission, although the MP component (available in 2018?) will hopefully provide a few game modes similar to UT3 (i.e. bot matches) thereby providing eons of fun for years to come. 

Again, for anyone relatively new to this genre, but with a love of FPS's, this won't disappoint, especially given the support  for various control devices ! You certainly don't need to be a "Triple-D" or a flight-sim genius to enjoy this high octane, easily accessible, addictive arcade shooter and at this point, it's hard to pinpoint any significant negative aspects of the game. 

UPDATE 08 SEP: 
There have been a few build releases in the interim adding new weapons (timebomb), new CM maps (Blizzard - probably one of the best thus far) and overall game balance adjustments (some good, some not so good) . Overall, still highly recommended, although it's likely that a truly well balanced and well honed CM mode won't be seen until much further along in the dev cycle.

UPDATE 15 DEC: 
An additional CM map has now been added (Backfire), leadeboard scores have been completely reset, and further balance adjustments have been made. Balance however still appears to be an issue in Challenge Mode, particularly with a select few of the bot enemies (Reavers) as well as the RNG, which can at times be quite frustrating in "grinding" for that perfect run. Hopefully, they'll find that "sweet spot" in the next 3 or months leading up to final release.

UPDATE 18/07/18: 
This remains without a shadow of a doubt my absolute "go-to" game for sheer visceral excitement. Challenge Mode is definitely my vice and I'm hoping for some superlative killer community generated CM levels in the near future ....perhaps even co-op challenge mode will materialise at some point (I'd personally drop $$$ to see that come to fruition) ? 

Nuff said.....post-release, still highly recommended and extremely hard to beat (in more ways than one) as the consummate package !!

review:
This is the proper Descent sequel We have been waiting for! Current version is early stage include only three levels, one demo stage and one training stage. But the feeling is great. Total flashback. :-)

My only critique could be about performance. It's way too heavy for that it is. However I believe that final version will be much more optimised and perform better.

My little about what I would love to see in final version:
- more texture tessellation (could add additional realistic feel). 
- more visual feedback when get hit or being too close to detonation (could add more tension).
- playstation VR release ... :-)

My prediction is that this revival is going to rock!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035927359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1559425811}
review:
This is the 6 DOF game that I and everyone else has been waiting for. This is Descent in everything but name. I can't wait to play the full game. I am very happy with the early alpha thus far. The developers keep in contact just enough to ensure that we know whats going on, which keeps them focused on adding contact and continuing to polish Overload without distraction. Many games have tried to get that "Descent feel" and have failed miserably (I'm looking at you Descent: Underground). Everyone on the Revival Studios deserves thanks for the amazing work that they are doing. I want to thank Matt, Mike and Luke for the Descent series which gave me such a memorable childhood and for Overload which my chiildren will play some day.

For anyone that is on the fence, just buy the game. You won't be dissapointed, and you will have a great time.

Basically a really decent game still in production hope to come fall 2017 its really cool and oldschool but i grew up on Forsaken for example and flying in all directions is the s##t IMHO.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972745591', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1678192622}
review: Very much like Descent 1 & 2, absolutely brings me back to those memories.  While many of the weapons look a bit different they have the same feel and you can clearly tell which weapons they were influenced by.  A few things like the pickup sound are even near direct clones of Descent.  The only available level to play at the time of writing this, while short, is exactly the same feeling, twitchiness and exploration combined with combat against robots.  This will remain a very positive review if they finish this off and keep the same feeling.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999558093', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1575146981}
review:
Auch wenn das Spiel noch weit weg von einem vollen Release ist, bin ich aber schon begeistert.
Der Entwickler ver√∂ffentlicht regelm√§√üige Updates, die neue Level aber auch neue Waffen/Raketen
beinhalten (k√∂nnen).

Das Gameplay ist, was das wichtigste ist, sehr klassisch gehalten und vom Gef√ºhl her 
genau das, was es sein soll: Eine neuerer geistiger Ableger von Descent.
Und genau so spielt es sich auch, nur eben bedeutend fl√ºssiger, sch√∂ner.
Eben moderner. 

Wer damals Descent spielte, wird sich sehr sehr heimisch f√ºhlen, und wom√∂glich sogar
ein wenig nostalgisch werden. Von mir gibt's einen Daumen hoch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008054349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1558550245}
review:
This game shows great potential.

I've played Descent 1 - 3 since 1994, an Overload feels like Descent again.

The big strenght of Descent was the gameplay, the bot ai and the automap feature.

Overload even improved the automap with the heatmap, at the end of the level you
can look at the whole level and it also shows where you killed bots (red dot) and 
where you took damage (blue dot).

The enemy bots show intelligent behaviour and there are several types already,
I very much like the close combat bot that charges you with two sawblades.

The controls also work very well. I play with a 3 axis joystick for turning and 
a keyboard for sliding, you have the option to map a key for slide toggle which
lets you slide left-right and up-down with the joystick just like the original Descent
had (this feature is sadly missing in Descent: Underground).

In short:
This game is the spiritual successor of Descent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971757795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1699583484}
review: Excellent game. It's gorgeous and plays like Descent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013281365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1592026862}
review: There is not a ton of content yet, but the challenges are lots of fun and I enjoy replaying them and trying different difficulties.  The updates are pretty regular, and I have seen very few bugs in the updates.  They updates are unannounced and you don't know whats in them until they are released.  If you are a fan of the early descent games you will love this game.  Lots of great stuff and looks like more to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970556268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1710032420}

very good...

author: {'steamid': '76561198216996861', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 75142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 281, 'playtime_at_review': 10445, 'last_played': 1712194803}
review:
Leaving my Early Access review below.  What this team has done over this past year is mind blowing.  The care and love they have for this game is obvious.  This early access proccess has been the most enjoyable that I've participated in and this is the best gaming community I've had the pleasure of being a part of.  We've all been waiting 20+ years for this.  Well, here it is.  Buy it.


I just finished my first playthrough of the story.....It was far beyond my expectations.  Even after seeing what these developers can do for the past year, I wasn't ready.  This is so. damn. good.  Every second was enjoyable.  Every level was a blast.  All the new enemies are great additions and the story was excellent.  I found 0 of the secret levels on my first playthrough (serioiusly).  I didn't explicitly look for them, but thats how well hidden they are lol.  

I put nearly 80 hours into the MP beta for the 3 or so weeks I was in it.  I think that should tell ya how I feel about that aspect of the game.  It's fantastic and has become my go-to multiplayer experience.  

Challenge Mode is what I sunk nearly 140 hours into during the EA process.  It is simply excellent (seem to be using synonyms of this word a lot lol).  

Check out the Playable Teaser.  See how you feel.  I will see you in the mines afterwards ;). 

"Conquered, Annexed, Devoured."


Early Access Review:

Like everyone before me has said, if you have fond memories of Descent, this game is certainly for you.  I ended up purchasing the game as soon as I played through the demo level for the first time.  Twas love at first play.
The controls feel great.  The level design is great (from what i've seen so far).  The map design is great (seriously, this is how you make a player map).  The sound effects are great.  The music is great.  The enemy design is awesome.  The weapons feel really meaty and fun to use.  The game overall just FEELS good, ya know?  Doesnt hurt that it runs flawlessly on my rig.  Maybe I'm hitting the nostalgia feelings hard, but I am in love with this already.  Can't wait to see where the devs take it.

*update*  controls - I just purchased a HOTAS setup the other day and this game works beautifully with it.  There is no going back to m+kb after having experienced this game with a HOTAS.  Thats not to say the m+kb contols arent phenomenal, they are, but wow is this game a blast with a joystick and throttle.   This is probably the best EA purchase I've made.  The game is brilliant.

** Now playing with dual joysticks.  EXCELLENT.

*****Thought I should comment on the dev's.  These guys are awesome.  Consistent and reliable communication.  Meaningful monthly updates!  It is so great to see this in the mass of lost EA titles nowadays.  I have complete confidence in this team and this game.  It is an absolute joy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051767708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1710656954}
review: If you are a fan of Descent in any way, this is the game you have been waiting for. This is truly one of the few early access games that I am glad I invested in.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997691407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1709006010}
review: Single player is so fucking brilliant!  this is real Descent, unlike the infamous "Descent:Underground" which was a pile of shit.   One warning though: The skill floor in mutliplayer is pretty high up, so unless you've played Descent 1 and 2 back in the day, you're gonna struggle so don't expect alot of people playing online for obvious reason in this neutered generation of gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967977944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 11307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8613, 'last_played': 1560264826}
review:
This is the true successor to the Descent series, brought to you by Revival Productions, with a dev team including the fouders of Parrallax.   And their mark on the history of Online gaming deserves to be noted.   For those of you whipper snappers who aren't in the know, 

These guys played a huge part in the creation of Online gaming as we know it.   I dont want to get into a history lesson, however - this development team in my opinion, are the creme de la creme.  Throughout the early access release I have been nothing but impressed with these guys and the work they've put into the game. The amount of features they've added and adjusted in support of the PC gaming community has been massive. Controller support, VR support, TrackIR support, if your kitchen sink had a usb cable you could plug it in.  Ok.. exaggeration* 

That being said - if you were a fan of the Descent series - This game is definitely for you.  You'll be able to relive the glory days these youngsters just don't know about. 

If you're new to the genre, this game is ultimately a shooter.  If you know your way around a mouse and keyboard, you'll be able to adapt to this.  Just think of it like - not only can you move forward/backward/left/and right. You can go up and down as well.   Congratulations you can pilot a spaceship and begin unleashing your wrath on a hoarde of killer robots, blow up the reactor and escape the mines.  Oh, and don't worry, the dizziness goes away eventually. 

This game has a fun factor that is 10 out of 10, and the dev team has shown interest in listening to opinions that keep it that way.  

Don't believe me? Try out the free demo.. just search for the overload teaser on the Steam store.   Just get a feel of how that flies, and how the game runs.   Now imagine doing that playing against other people in maps with multiple exits in every room, where you have the option to fly away and try to pick which door the enemy least suspects you to come out of. 

As the devs work to release the game on console, I have to say, if you enjoy GOOD shooters, and PC gaming in general... BUY THIS GAME. I'm not popular enough to get paid for saying that.   The involvement from the dev teams throughout the development of Overload has earned that from me without charge. 

There are too many words for me to type.. go download the free teaser.. get a feel for the ship. Think of it as a shooter, and have fun.   If you want to plug in an expensive hotas, rudder pedals and the like, or stick to your mouse + KB for that pinpoint accuracy only a mouse can provide. 

Whatever the case, if you've never played a 6DoF shooter but like blowing stuff up.. this game is a must buy in my book.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005778962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1690123395}
review:
I only needed to play this game for about 15 minutes before my muscle memory was back from 1995.  Plays and feels EXACTLY the same as legacy Descent 1/2, except much more streamlined features and absolutely BEAUTIFUL and CLEAN graphics and interface.  The weapons are definite improvements over the original descent designs while being somewhat familiar in feel.  You can tell they've tapped into modern computing power which enabled some more advanced mechanics and visuals.  THIS is how video games were meant to be played.  Nobody to this day has made a combat game like Descent EXCEPT for this team, and this title perfectly brings back the complete smooth 3-dimensional control combat mechanics.

The biggest CON for this title at the moment is the utter lack of multiplayer PVP (local LAN support especially important for those 90's Descent fanboys out there).  I read that they are promising a multiplayer expansion in 2018.  I can't wait.  But I guess that gives me plenty of time to grind through the single player content up to the highest difficulty.

Good luck dev's, stay vigilent, keep up the excellent work.
-CCBB

[update 2/4/2018] - Haven't played in a while, booted this game up in VR mode with the Oculus to give it a try and WOW.  It's almost like this game was meant for VR.  It's probably top 2 or 3 on my favorite games to play in VR.  It works perfectly, great job to the devs, no hiccups or framerate issues, everything plays incredibly well in VR.  ALSO - based on their latest news release they will be adding multiplayer in the 2018 go-live release!!!!! I'm super stoked for that decision, well done.  Can't wait to play this with my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999548270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1244, 'last_played': 1624160851}

The look and feel are true to the original Descent games.   It literally took me 5 minutes of playing the free teaser to buy this game... MORE?  YES PLEASE!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010386539', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1668907028}
review:
Absolutely fantastic. It's more of what Material Defenders need. The devs are making great calls with the development of this game. It's pure and untainted Descent action with a nostalgic yet refreshed facelift. Flight physics feel great great, atmosphere is vastly improved, subtle destruction upon damaged robots is a nice touch, the robots are legit scary looking, and they sound more manacing than ever. The soundtrack by Dan Wentz is great and is exactly what Descent always needed; looking forward to purchasing or downloading the music.

Don't tell Interplay, but I'm definitely casually calling this Descent 4.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988310182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1706373041}
review: True Descent-feeling reborn! Thank you guys, you are making a great job!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005242943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 15, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1711810997}
review:
Wow, these guys have masterfully recreated the old Descent feel. The pumping adrenaline, frantic manuevers, blazing guns, and devilishly clever and aggresive AI. 

The first time I fired up Overload and peered into those dark caverns, desparately trying to discern where that evil throbbing was coming from, I was instantly transported back to those suspensful moments in the first two games.

Returning veterans will find familiar yet fresh enemies, weapons, and upgrades. Newcomers will find a slick and addictive zero-G dogfighter, though you may need to take some dramamine on your first ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972453391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 154121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 606, 'playtime_at_review': 3329, 'last_played': 1712368509}

review: Das Spiel lief auf meinem Mac ca. eine halbe Stunde - das war's dann. Beim Start zeigte sich nur noch ein abwechselnd schwarzer oder flimmernder Bildschirm. Auch eine komplette Neuinsatllation sowohl des Spiels, als auch der Steam-App brachte keine Abhilfe. Kein Foren-Tipp half weiter. Das einzig Positive: Der Kaufpreis wurde umgehend zur√ºck erstattet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993001326', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1534295820}
review:
The ONLY game I ever loved was Descent, mostly online D2 play, so I really liked what I heard about Overload. After playing for 30 minutes, all I can say is THANK YOU. I can't wait to get a real joystick and relive the good times. 

This game feels so much like Descent, but looks like you would expect it to look for a modern game. I'm already wanting some good ol' PVP and PVE with a map as fun as all the Minerva maps from back in the day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004554568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 162, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1712073938}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007184546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1535229935}
review: Did you ever play Descent? Descent II? Then you're going to love this game to pieces. It's so good. The feel of everything is just perfect. I am loving every minute of this game so far and it just feels so nostalgic in all the right ways. I'm also very excited about finding secrets and getting to upgrade things based on that in the story mode. And the challenge mode is just a whole lot of fun too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970752567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1553330016}
review: A very cool refresh of the old Descent series. The graphics are great and smooth as butter. The flight mechanics are super fun just like they used to be. The level design so far feels like the original series but is far more polished, The bot design and AI are good, and the guns and missles are even better. Even the music is more modern while maintaining the correct ambiance. I'm really looking forward to the bosses.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972353005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1495895761}
review:
Yes! YES! Y E S !!!
Like all others posted before: 
THIS is the game we've been waiting for!
I bought it the instant I read that the original devs of Decent did this.
And yes: the feeling is there right from the beginning. There is absolutely nothing more to say than: 
a) you liked Decent? => You're save, buy this. You cannot go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153650068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1701185986}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126027461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1664402412}
review: The single greatest follow up/remake of the descent games. Though keep in mind its still in early access so content is fairly limited, but constantly expanding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168548878', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1583704112}
review:
Great game! 
Overload delivers the long awaited new descent game. I enjoyed the combat, it was fun and the levels that are in the game right now, all be it a bit small, look great and play great. The game feels like a descent game and if you enjoyed that aspect of the original games then you will love his game. I do have a few dislikes however, firstly the robots look too similar and there is no message like in the original descents about how these robots operate. There is also the problem of the spawners spawning way no many enimies for a player on a harder difficulty than rookie to deal with. Of cause you have to remember hat this game IS in development and many of these issues may be felt with. I feel like this game has huge potential and can fit the gap made by the 'descent underground' game that is now beginning to look like a cash grab. With a few tweaks and more content this game could become the descent game we have all been waiting for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972330714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1702700566}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969379991', 'num_games_owned': 1013, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1527960095}
review: been waiting like 20 years for an updated descent game. very well done so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053185508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 878, 'last_played': 1565677674}
review:
Hell yeah...this is it...THIS is that Descent Lovin' feeling. THis is the game Underground should have been but isn't because they added all that Gimmicy BULLCRAP. Its just you, some robots pretty a** levels, Nice ass soundtrack and plenty of guns to blow s**t up with. This is the modern port to Descent Ive been wanting for a long time.

I will say however I get lots of crashes to desktop. Perhaps is just a beta bug but I got this a lot with the playable demo...hopefully gets ironed out eventually.

Edit: After a few updates the game refuses to run on my system for more than a few seconds. There seems to be some driver conflicts between this and my Nvidia card and ive been doing everything humanly possible and scouring the internet for over a month now just to get this ONE game to run properly. I'll change my review once the bugs are worked out.

*Update*

After months of figthing with my rig I finally reverted back to windows 7 from winblows 10. NO PROBLEMS WHATSOEVER.  Seems winblows was my issue with the driver conflicts. 

This released version is THE SHIT. easily now one of my favorite games. They definitely knocked this one out the park.  The attention to little small details in the game from the weapon effects to the mech deaths show they REALLY put some love into this game. It simply feels like im flying an updated version of Descent, and that is NOT a bad thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988823556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 2779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2262, 'last_played': 1609079032}
review:
Played the impressive teaser and I cloudn't resist to give a chance for this game. Everything seems to be right with this new "Descent" game.

Level design = classic multidimensional maps. At first maps seem simple but there is always new dimensions in level design. First you see some what simple room but after a while you found a corner where you can access new areas. As a huge original Descent fan I'm loving it. Multiple secrets are adding also their part to the tasty cake

Enemies = They have character simply some kind of charismatic and aggressive enemies.

Graphics = Loving it simple great quality in graphics. Runs really smoothly. Loving that kind of polygon type of design which comes from the original series Descent 1 & 2. The cockpit could look much more detailed but otherwise everything is in the right place.

Overall Overload is _the descent game_ you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995461903', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1705666385}
review: I grew up with Descent 1 and 2, and this is very much what I've been waiting for!

author: {'steamid': '76561198129887313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1525118403}
review: Overload really feels like a modern version of Descent. The graphics are great and playing is a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984851541', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 57304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 100, 'playtime_at_review': 3228, 'last_played': 1711421102}
review: Strongly recommending Overload. The looks are amazing, the feel is spot-on, and once challenge mode gets balanced juuuuust right and the campaign is released, this will be everything everyone's ever wanted out of a Descent 4. Then we get multiplayer and a level editor. 20 good years of the 6-degrees-of-freedom mantle is about to be carried many more by this game. I'm normally extremely hesitant to buy early access titles (I kickstarted this one too, as a show of faith) -- given the slate of content currently available and the regularity and size of updates, you'll have your money's worth before this hits 1.0.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068476886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1492977326}
review: Not much to say really - if you remember Descent fondly, you'll love this game, so get it. If you don't remember Descent, then get this game, you'll love it :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960410235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1657500785}
review:
If you want the _first_ genuine, modern version of Descent 1 / 2, this is the game for you. The action is fast paced and fun. The levels are excellent & interesting thus far in EA. The visuals, sounds, and music are spot on. The game looks, feels, and plays just like the sequel I'd hoped for for decades.

(Already put many hours into the free demo version.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971243199', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1705, 'last_played': 1696575117}
review: it's very good. maybe the first 6dof game that i like better than descent 2. the challenge mode is fantastic, can't get enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977046048', 'num_games_owned': 823, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1695231294}
review:
Yep, this is Descent.

The physics, the art design, the sound design, the gameplay - it's all on point. This truly IS the proper successor to Descent. 

I haven't had this much fun with a 6DoF game since Sublevel Zero, truly. Before that, the crown belonged to Descent 3. This tops them all, by far. And this is even in Early Access. The game already feels quite polished despite the lack of content, and is definitely a ride - especially in VR.

Whether you're a veteran to the genre or a newcomer, I very highly recommend picking this one up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018288710', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1528084096}
review:
This is it, this is the game everyone from the Descent series had been hoping for. It truly feels like a modernized Descent and we havent even seen any of the story yet.. You dont have to use a joystick for it to feel that way (I did back in the day), the mouse controls actually feel very, very good, this coming from a long time Quake / TF2 player. They've done an amazing job so far and I really can't wait to see what more they have for us later.

Update: Release was 100% exactly without fail what I was hoping it would be. I'm having so much fun with the story mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027959928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 2244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1667334840}
review:
Modern day Descent!
Everything feels 'right': bots, weapons, ship control, levels, everythig.
In particular - beautiful, tidy and informative HUD. Visceral sounds. Satisfying projectile-based 6dof dogfight.
This game's got everything I wanted when I backed up this kickstarter campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115693013', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1182, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1712269626}
review:
This is Descent as it is supposed to be. Overload catches 100% of the original gameplay and atmosphere: Flying through narrow and dark tunnels, caverns and rooms, peering around corners, always looking out for bots which may sneak up at you and suddenly firing at you.

A nice selection of weapons and missiles closely resembled to their original Descent counterparts. Same goes for power-ups and game mechanics: flares, the way doors open, flight control, etc; everything is just plain Descent but with more modern and polished graphics.

Since this is Early Access, not all content is yet available. The single player campaign is still worked on, you just get one level from it (as of April 18th), however, more content is added constantly. Just check out the timeline of the devs.

With multiplayer being implemented (announced after game release) and level editor in the works this game has so much potential. Overload is THE Descent of the 21st Century. :)

PS: I am playing on Linux.It's just amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968255052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1528649871}
review:
A great spiritual successor to Descent, made by some of the original team members. Graphics look really good and now framerate issues. Really solid for Early Access. 

Still trying to figure out the optimal control scheme (back in the day, I only used a Sidewinder from Microsoft to play). Steam Controller emulating both Gamepad and Mouse seems to be optimal so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970382727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1563640291}
review: geil will mehr

author: {'steamid': '76561198077314553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1492122120}
review:
I am running the latest version of this app on a 2.6GHz 4GB Macbook Pro running 10.11.6 and 256MB NVIDIA GeForce 9400M.   Being a OG (original gamer), I loved Descent when it came out, and played every version of it.  I want to like Overload.  I want to say nothing but wonderful things about it.  I've waited a long time.  But, I can't.  

From the beginning, the game errored on load with a missing executable error.  When it finally did launch, I could not manage any of the configuration settings.  It then hung, and I had to reboot the laptop to clear it.  On reload, it jacked the display.  Reboot 2.  Every reload since, nothing displays.  I get music, background sound effects if I hit random keys, and a black screen.

I may try a few more times; but, at this juncture, I'm about ready for a refund.  Willing to supply logs or other data to assist devs in troubleshooting.  Point me in the right direction.  Fix the issues, and i will update this review or write a new one.  Otherwise, as of now, I cannot recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013025716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1666553740}
review: Descent 4 VR. It's amazing. All it needs is a little more OGRE/Skinny Puppy in the soundtrack and a more simplicity in optimizing settings for VR. Still- a definite buy. Great work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983436748', 'num_games_owned': 1123, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1491581907}
review:

Good graphics, gameplay is spot on. Can‚Äôt wait to see how this develops. Maybe wish there was just a bit more to do but it is EA and I only had one crash so a solid start!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094489466', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1528291702}
review:
It's probably too incomplete for someone unfamiliar with the originals but it's a solid foundation for what I hope ends up being a great game.

There's definitely nostalgia factor because I loved the original descent games even though I was terrible at them as a kid.

The challenge modes and the demo levels play extremely well and are very fun. 

Only criticisms so far:

1. I can't play this effectively with a steam controller or gamepad. The controls functioned much better with a mouse and keyboard.
2. The explosion particles are too big at times. I know  this sounds weird, but sometimes I'd waste rounds or rockets on a robot I had already destroyed. 

Good things:
1. Challenge mode feels finished and makes me feel like the narrative missions will be worth the wait.
2. The controls, motion, and weapons feel right. The projectile weapons feel a bit underpowered due to their reduced range but they still feel like they have impact.
3. The robot designs I've seen so far are very reflective of the original source material. I love the boxy utilitarian look they have -- they look like robots in Descent should. 
4. The "find the exit, find the reactor, blow it up and get out" gameplay cycle shown in the demo level plays exactly as I would like.
5. The map system is good.
6. Using keyboard and wasd to play this feels great and feels very natural.
7. It runs great on my old graphics card  -- a GTX 960 4GB -- at a consistent 40-60+.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025506597', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1694142962}
review: Don't let the name fool you - this is Descent. It feels the same, sounds the same (Allister Brimble!), has the same level of polish, and the same excellence in level design. Yes, it's early access, but these people clearly know what they're doing and have already added one of the campaign levels as of March 28. The difference between this and the other "Descent reboot" is like night and day, this is hands down the superior game in every aspect that matters. If you loved the original Descent games, you'll love this one too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981507240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1688058404}
review:
It's hard to write something objective since this is basically my dream game. The look, the music, the whole atmosphere...
This IS Descent 4.
The game is pretty basic, but in an entirely good way. The core gameplay is excellent, the bot design on point, the whole art direction more than fitting.
The singleplayer campaign can't release soon enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023716920', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1587174389}
review:
[THIS GAME IS STILL IN THE EARLY STAGES OF EARLY ACCESS.  THERE IS ONLY ONE STORY LEVEL, THE LEVEL FROM THE TEASER AND A FEW CLALLENGE MAPS.  I STILL RECOMMEND BUYING THIS GAME TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE TRUE SUCCESSOR OF THE DESCENT SERIES]

I will update this review for the coming game content updates.

I really see and feel Descent with this game, the gameplay, the visuals and the music really make me think of the original Descent. I am most impressed with this and am glad I have supported development by purchasing this game in Early Access. I am not a fan of Descent: Underground, which ended up as an average(ish) MMO and does not deserve the Descent Branding. Overload really should be Descent IV.  at the time of this review this game is still very early in development, but so far I am impressed.  

The controls feel fluid and rock solid, and the gameplay mechanics and physics are well....   Descent like. for want of a better word.

This is a great way to relive the glory days of Descent in a modern form.  
Like a true Descent game Singleplayer is the focus.  Multiplayer will be added later.  
Unlike Descent:  Underground, which is an MMO and the only news about a story campaign is "we're working on it" which is wearing thin.

So get Overload, rather than Descent: Underground if a true successor to the Descent Lineage is what your trigger fingers are craving for!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032575750', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1674794094}
review: Already a lot of fun. "Feels" like descent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961053737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1528824310}
review:
I don't want to knock Wingman's effort to revive Descent. However, I feel Overload does it right: They're focusing on the (tight and smooth) controls first, followed by singleplayer, with multiplayer coming lateron. Whereas Descent Underground just doesn't feel like a Descent game, this absolutely does. From the butter-smooth 6dof controls to the wonderfully sinister robots, this is Descent for the year 2017. VR support is a given, and indeed it works extremely well in VR.

Remember back in 94 when you heard about that VFX1 VR headset that worked with Descent, but nobody could actually afford? It really wasn't that great actually, but man were we eager to play this in proper VR. Now you can.

If you liked Descent, this comes highly recommended.

Update October 2017: The latest update added another campaign level, more robots and overall feels like an extremely polished game. And even the escape sequence is back! If you want a proper sequel, this is it.

Update December 2017: My performance woes in VR have been resolved by the latest updates. The new maps are a treat and I love the timebomb gadget, which is a nice throwback to F.E.A.R.
It's a testament to this game that I am looking forward to more maps to play on more than any other game feature. Except multiplayer/coop maybe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290973271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1288, 'last_played': 1701189199}
review:
Having played the early release now for a few weeks I have to give credit firstly to the developer who made the fireworks on explosive combat and ALSO, hopefully not an unsung Hero, the person in charge of the AUDIO. 
I just purchased a new speaker system. Its like I was deaf before. :-)
I cannot believe the quality of audio while playing this game, aside from the panic, stress, "HOLY MOSES Where did THAT come from" and "Dammit!" as I spin in yet another golden  starburst of defeat. 
The noise of this game is astounding. From the weapons to the crunch of metal impacts to their death-grunts. Horroble creature noises as if something was alive in the shell of the exploding Robot and this wierd really spooky gutteral throat-splutter. Creepy.

The craft are gorgeous to look at and their controls are veryr ealistic. Enough drift to feel youre flying and hovering and enough manouvrability to swing in and out of obstacles. 
The environments are thoughtfully created.  We've all seen digital worlds from laboratories to sunny wastelands but this is a kind of mixture of rocky tunneling as well made by "something burrowing!!!" and hi tech arenas.

Only one thing I would like included. I enjoy the surprise of these Bots springing out at me and the "heart leap" as they appear and blast me to hell BUT..... I would like them to hum, whine, whirr or clatter as they ambled about chasing me. Not just whine deafeningly with a circular saw chiseling off my shields. 

If you remember Descent of olde, this is just like that only better. All the good points emphasised. 
If you dont know what Descent was because you're too young.... you're in for a mean surprise. 
It's already money well spent and it isn't finished yet. 
I hold my breath because I think an ultimate Challenge is going to be playing online against people across the world. 
THAT  I await with impatience. 
Neil Armstrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987982145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1630184893}
review:
There is no wrong in this, only my inept skills. I loved the old Descent games and now I can play the future version now and by the same people. I feel no remorse on this purchase. Thank you :)

+ Controls are tight and feel absolutely correct
+ Power ups when you need them and a good amount of health and shields as you're fighting
+ The sounds and the colour choices are spot on
+ I like that the AI shows intellegence and react to you and does try to be sneaky
+ Endless mode, endless mode... damn boys you dun good
+ Developers still active and still motivated
+ I can play this right now and it will only get better with time

- My skills are lacking and I can't just sit here all day playing till I go blind 

Seriously though, a very fun game if you enjoyed the older games, you won't be disappointed. I felt a desire to show the developers my appreciation and bought the game. Hopefully it will fund them to do more projects like this. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967668791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1706242625}
review:
I've been somewhat obsessed with the original Descent all these years since the orginal release. For me it was one of those games I fondly remembered as one of the best ever. A game that I thought had always been vastly under rated and I would rave about it to anyone I could over the years. Descent was so damn fun and multiplayer was amazing. Hiding upside down on the roof of a a tunnle waiting for your victum to fly underneath you then drop down like a gd spider king. Awesome! When steam released 1,2, and 3 I was overjoyed. When Descent Underground was announced I was again overjoyed and had high hopes. Well since it's beta release I've been disappointed. Not that it's a bad game, but it just didn't feel like the descent I remembered. In fact lots of other companies have tried to recreate 6dof but none have felt "right".

Until now. Overload from the orginial creators of Descent absolutely feels "right". It's actually superb, perfect, excelent, amazing, and awesome. It is the perfect game all over again. It's not just a remake with updated graphics, I mean it is that but they've really topped themselves here. It's just like original Descent but fresh and new. I think it feels a bit darker in tone than the orginial. Just a bit though not too much. A little more hard scifi serious but still very much Descent like. The robots are 10x better with 10x better A.I. Each bot is different with different movement and attacks. The level design is 10x better, they're bigger, badder, and prettier with more floors and more twists and turns, and more secrets. The graphics are also 10x better with more partical effects and cooler lighting. I was really impressed with how well the caverns were done. They're pitch black. You have to use your flares to navigate and when you light them up they're beautiful. The flares shoot ahead of you for a bit then slowly die out prompting you to launch another. Meanwhile enemy bots are hunting you. You get a jump scare when they pop up behind you, above you, below you, etc. Omg what a start. If this is just the tip of the iceburg we are in for one hell of a game here.

This is the game I've wished and hoped for for the last 20 years. All I can say to the developers is thank you, thank you, thank you so much. I can't wait for the full release. I urge anyone even remotely curiouse to go ahead and pick this up I don't think you'll be disappointed at all. They are delivering exactly what they've promised here. It's flawless in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030391458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1559157192}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991813023', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1628777476}
review:
RE-EDIT

Its basically my favorite game, revived ! Its Descent, with better sounds, better graphics, better music, better everything, in smooth, 1080p, 60fps goodness!! I LOVE the voice actors (one of the the new Doom game voices, "every doctors voice" in half life)

WINGNUT IS BACK (hes not called that, but i call him wingnut)
and boy does he help in terms of finding the objectives. BUT, dont rush through the levels as they are SWAMPED with secret areas withholding goodies for you to find!

Levels get increasingly more difficult (as is to be expected) and it feels great cause you get to upgrade your ship. 10 / 10 , this is my game for 2018, my early bday present!
Thank you devs <3 




This was my review prior to release
posted: 24 Jun, 2017

Its being made by parts of the old Parallax team! Unlike the other Decent "clones" and "wannabes" out there, this one has a large chunk of the original team building it. and booooooooy does it show.

The reviews here all agree "its JUST like the old Descent".
Indeed it is! It FEELS like Descent, it looks like a more modern version of Descent, and it even SOUNDS like Descent, music AND sound effects! and of course, the good ol "find keys to open doors", to "find the reactor" to, "find the exit" procedure. aahh nostalgic goodness! (when enemy locks on to you, its the same sound from back in the day <3   )
(is NOT the case anymore)

i for one LOVE this game so far. oh haha.... and my GOD is it cool in VR. Back in the Descent days, in the "ms dos setup part" of the game, there were options to use "VR goggles", and I was always sad not being able to try it. Well folks.... with the VIVE....... its unbelievable!!!

10 / 10 would buy again but i already own it

author: {'steamid': '76561197973316775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 4520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2590, 'last_played': 1658156997}
review:
I have the demo and the EA version. I played all the Descent games when they were originally released and played them alot. They were one of my favorite games.
There are several 6DOF games out right now. One even with the Descent name. Descent Underground is a hoax. Don't be fooled by their promises. It will likely never be finished. It is awful to play. They even pulled it from Steam because of all the bad reviews.
Make no mistake, Overload is the real sucessor to Descent. Two minutes into the game tell you that. The look and feel are all there. This is SP first then MP second. Just like Descent. The very first demo they offered was amazingly accurate to the original. Best of all is the ship control using whatever you brought. The game is priced right, You can't go wrong with this. They are also planning a map editor which will make loads of maps available to us just like before as well as a MP DLC. EDIT: MP will be included in the release.
The game does not include coop. This would be a great addition but at this point, there is no commitment to it. Too bad.
This game is a 10/10 IMO even before it's done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969831909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1658865956}
review:
It is about time a true Descent like game gets made, one that captures all the essence of Descent series and bringing it with todays graphics. This game is fun, fast paced, balls to to wall 6 degrees of freedom, robot destroying FPS. I highly recommend this game. 

This game has a lot of difficulty options, enough that can be good for any player of any skill.

The AI is phenominal, with each type of AI having unique personalites in their combat styles.

Also they will be releasing a level editor for this game, so you can make your own levels and play other peoples levels, so that can add endles more fun.

The music is phenomenal.  The music is done by the same people who did the music for Descent 1-3, and really adds to the ambiance as well as the intensitity of the fights.  There is also a lot of different pieces of music, I honestly can't remember any piece of music repeating from one level to the next, and it even changes to a new piece while in the levels at times.

I use KB/Mouse, and the controls are fantastic.  For me it feels just like Descent, even the ships acts the same way, you do feel like you are in a ship when controling it.  You can change any of the controls to whatever key you want.

There are many secrets through out each level and I really enjoy looking for them.  I especially love it when the game toys with you by showing you a secret from the other side of a grate, and you have to go on a hunt to find how to get to it.

As you go through the levels you can find upgrade points, this allows you to upgrade your ship and weapons in various ways.  You will not be able to upgrade everything to the fullest, so you kind of have to pick and choose what you want to have the most upgraded.  Though there is New Game+, so you can probably get everything up eventually, though I am not sure about that, other than there is new game+

Along with the single player campaign, which the storyline was written by the Freespace 2 writer and it is a great storyline, there is also challenge mode.  There are more than 12 maps and different modes for each maps to fight through, gaining experience points to upgrade your Challenge mode ship/weapons.  There is also a leader board so you can see how you are doing against other people.  I love the challenge maps cause they are great for shorter bursts of gameplay depending on what kind of time you have.  The challenge mode maps are not the same map as the campaign maps, which really adds to the variety.

The maps nearly feel like a sprawling maze, and given that you have 6 degrees of freedom you can easily get lost or disoriented.  There is a guide bot in the game if you want a little help to get where you need to get to, though it will not help you find secrets.

The sound effects in the game are very satisfying.  Each weapon sounds different from another, the robots explode with a nice "boom" sound to go along with it.

In the single player campaign there are data points to pick up that give you audio logs that give you backstory of what happened on the map you are on.  These adds a lot of the storyline and I really enjoy it.

Overall I highly recommend the game.  If you loved Descent series, then chances are you'll love this game, cause it really does feel like playing Descent but with upgraded graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961115580', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1667125153}
review:
OMG ! Descent is really back ! It's just like back in 1996 !
The original Descent games are one of my favorite games of all time. I played them first as a child, and I still enjoy them today.
I saw that the creators of the original games are involved in this, so I thought I have to try this.

I just started the demo mission and after the first minute I got a huge smile on my face... it's Descent... after 20 years it's coming back!

The music, the controls, the maps, the enemies, the atmosphere, everything is just right !
And it's only an early version !

I can't wait for the full game ! Support the devs ! Make it happen !

author: {'steamid': '76561198057736716', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1710495963}
review:
I've never had so much fun in a game with no story or actual campaign even in it yet. Now, I was a fan of the early Descent II, played it every time Mum would let me. However, I was never able to really get into it. So, as a fan of the series of old, and as a [i]relatively[/i] new player to the 6-degrees-of-freedom genre, let me tell you this, plain and simple:
Overload is, and is set to be, an absolutely fantastic, edge-of-seat, secret packed, awesome looking game for every generation of game players. Made by the same loving team that made the original games, their only goal is exactly what any game devloper's of long-lasting games, and any fans of such, should be - to make the old games live again, but better. And, thus far, in it's heart, in it's graphics, in it's AI and it's gameplay, in the fluid controls and smooth, super-future HUD, this game damn well delivers. 
I can't wait to see what we get when the fully built, fully completed game releases. I, for one, know it will be the story and the vision I've always wanted, and it will be absolutely worth the wait. In the mean time, I'll be replaying the demo mission  if anyone needs me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121659836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3054, 'last_played': 1694209508}
review: Gameplay and controls are true to Descent I & II.  Levels are a bit more AAA style and not quite so indie (which would be nice to see from the original dev team, but you can find plenty of Community created levels that scratch that itch, including some re-creations of D1 levels by Yinut!).  VR is also good, but bring your dramamine, or get ready for lots of practice time to cut down on the nausea!  Full disclosure:  I paid $120 to support the development through kickstarter and received all the betas and one Steam key of the final version for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998128953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1690554906}
review:
Although there isn't much content in Overload and despite some crashes I encountered, I definitely like this game more than the direct competitor "Descent Underground". Overload gets the old Descent feeling way better. That's for several reasons:

Overload's gameplay is way more fun. The action takes place mostly in close combat, where navigation is key without the game being too hectic. Your weapons have this Ooomph that just feels right. Also the weapons have a good variety (I love the Creeper mines and the Driller cannon!). Enemy's have good recognizable silhouettes and an already pretty good variety. Although the levels are small in this Early Access version, they are well structured and despite one section in the demo level that's labyrinth-like have a clear layout where it's hard to lose track.

The graphics are great. Yeah, they are more simple than in other games, but that's for the better in this kind of genre. When your action is fast paced and your orientation is difficult because of the six degrees of freedom, it is best to keep the visuals simple to not overexert the eyes (as Descent Underground does). It has style and atmosphere and serves the gameplay - and for me that's far more important than fancy shaders and trillions of polygons on screen.

My only cons thus far:
- I encountered several crashes
- there is only one single player level
- there are only four challenge levels
- there is no multiplayer

So only buy this, if you want to support the devs, not if you want to have a complete game to play. It's far from finished. But I'm pretty damn sure the finished game (announced for fall 2017 as far as I know) will be awesome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198180823583', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1708627360}

review:

Ohne noch mehr zu schreiben, im Demo Teaser zum Spiel kann sich jeder selbst ein Ersteindruck machen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000219173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1336, 'last_played': 1659196870}
review:
18 March 2017, Version .1 Build 9
Minor Updates 25 April 2017, Version 0.3 Build 30
Disclaimer: Kickstarter Backer.

Alpha version number, late beta playability.
‚ÄòSurprisingly polished‚Äô would be an accurate summary of the game in its current state, with the majority of features at a stage that nears fully completed. Inputs are smooth and customizable, there‚Äôs a robust roster of primary and secondary weapons- each with a role and unique properties- an expansive number of robot enemies that complement each other, and very slick graphics.

Of particular noteworthiness are the enemies: they explode spectacularly which makes the so-far central wave survival mode visually rewarding, and each is unique in not only design and weapons but also behavior. For Descent veterans, you won‚Äôt find much that you don‚Äôt expect here, but if you enjoyed Descent, you‚Äôll enjoy Overload.

Currently the game features a [s]single[/s] pair of ‚Äòreal levels‚Äô, which mimics the gameplay of the original Descents 1 & 2; fly through the mines, shoot some robots, grab a couple weapons, then blow up the reactor and hightail it out of dodge. The original sample level is short and to the point, but features the familiar claustrophobic levels and secrets aplenty. The second sample level, said to be the third mission of story mode, is much expanded and quite long. It features additional mechanics such as robot spawners, locked doors, and rescuable hostages/cryopods. It also hints at an upgrade system with 'upgrade points' scattered about the level, but currently there doesn't seem to be a system for using them - presumably this is a feature that will occur between levels in story mode.
The premiere game mode is currently a wave survival mode, which is as straight forward as it gets: kill robots until they kill you, for glory and personal/online leaderboard high score. While the mode is nothing more than ‚Äòkill things‚Äô there is room for improvement with evidence of several systems which might be leveraged to add nuance to the mode, and you can earn (temporary, for the current life/attempt) weapon upgrades by reaching certain milestones. In addition to the endless style of the wave survival, there is also a timed survival style, where you must last five minutes against a much more aggressive spawn rate of enemies. There is no overt functional difference between the two modes other than the time limit. There are only [s]four[/s] six maps for the wave survival mode.

The game runs impressively well on a GTX 860M, 16GB RAM, and I7 6410HQ 2.5Ghz quad core. Though I don‚Äôt have the graphics maxed out, it looks plenty pretty with medium textures and normal post-processing options. I‚Äôve had no issues with stuttering or slowdown.

However, the game does have some particular shortfalls.
The graphics options menu is lacking in granularity/separate options, [s]and I haven‚Äôt seen support for 21:9 monitors, which is my desktop, but I don‚Äôt have access to that currently; the game may tailor available options based on detected capabilities. I will update this review to account for new information should that prove the case.[/s] FOV also maxes out at 80 degrees. Though the HUD is much improved from the Playable Teaser, I feel it has additional room for improvement. I find the music is also somewhat lacking, but that‚Äôs a pretty personal opinion and your mileage will vary greatly.
Update: Game DOES support 21:9 ratio, and it plays very well while doing so. HUD and menu is natively scaled, without stretching or other unflattering effects.

My overall recommendation for the game in its current state is: ‚ÄúRecommend Sale Purchase‚Äù.  Though the game is amazingly polished and very playable, there is not quite $25 worth of content at this immediate point in time. 
However, keep in mind that Early Access titles are investments, and if you act on faith here you will likely have an excellent product at the end of development. I personally look forward to the finished game and have confidence in the developer to deliver on their stated goals.

Update, 25 Apr: Added mention of 21:9, addtional SP level, number of challenge maps,

author: {'steamid': '76561198075525997', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1588926156}
review:
First impressions review in the HTC VIVE, full out VR mouse & keyboard no autolevel. 

This game is absolutely amazing for the fact that it really feels like I'm back in Descent, but with cutting edge VR technology and current day graphics. It's simply incredile. Smooth controls, lots of input options, well polished UI's for VR, an immersive feel, good enemy AI (much more mature that two other current 6dof shooters I've tried; those being Sublevel Zero and Descent Underground) and a far more "complete" feel to the single player experience.

I'm hoping this project continues, because I do look forward to playing a long, grueling solo campaign through as many levels as you can toss at me. Titan enemies (bosses) in large arenas could also be a plus to the current level-end "destroy the core" type mechanic. 

So far, excellent. I truly hope this project comes to completion, because the core elements are there, and they work better than any other games in this category.

Here's a first impressions video I made using the HTC VIVE:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NJeIXHCy5CE

I plan on trying it in the Rift sometime soon as well.
